commit_message:
Fix ordering when pacemaker with bundles is being used

If you gracefully restart a node with pacemaker on it, the following can happen:
1) docker service gets stopped first
2) pacemaker gets shutdown
3) pacemaker tries to shutdown the bundles but fails due to 1)

This can make it so that after the reboot, because shutting down the
services failed, two scenarios can take place:
A) The node gets fenced (when stonith is configured) because it failed to stop a resource
B) The state of the resource might be saved as Stopped and when the node
   comes back up (if multiple nodes were rebooted at the same time) the CIB
   might have Stopped as the target state for the resource.

In the case of B) we will see something like the following:

Online: [ overcloud-controller-0 overcloud-controller-1 overcloud-controller-2 ]

Full list of resources:

 Docker container set: rabbitmq-bundle [192.168.0.1:8787/rhosp12/openstack-rabbitmq-docker:pcmklatest]
   rabbitmq-bundle-0 (ocf::heartbeat:rabbitmq-cluster): Stopped overcloud-controller-0
   rabbitmq-bundle-1 (ocf::heartbeat:rabbitmq-cluster): Stopped overcloud-controller-0
   rabbitmq-bundle-2 (ocf::heartbeat:rabbitmq-cluster): Stopped overcloud-controller-0
 Docker container set: galera-bundle [192.168.0.1:8787/rhosp12/openstack-mariadb-docker:pcmklatest]
   galera-bundle-0 (ocf::heartbeat:galera): Stopped overcloud-controller-0
   galera-bundle-1 (ocf::heartbeat:galera): Stopped overcloud-controller-0
   galera-bundle-2 (ocf::heartbeat:galera): Stopped overcloud-controller-0
 Docker container set: redis-bundle [192.168.0.1:8787/rhosp12/openstack-redis-docker:pcmklatest]
   redis-bundle-0 (ocf::heartbeat:redis): Stopped overcloud-controller-0
   redis-bundle-1 (ocf::heartbeat:redis): Stopped overcloud-controller-0
   redis-bundle-2 (ocf::heartbeat:redis): Stopped overcloud-controller-0
 ip-192.168.0.12 (ocf::heartbeat:IPaddr2): Stopped
 ip-10.19.184.160 (ocf::heartbeat:IPaddr2): Stopped
 ip-10.19.104.14 (ocf::heartbeat:IPaddr2): Stopped
 ip-10.19.104.19 (ocf::heartbeat:IPaddr2): Stopped
 ip-10.19.105.11 (ocf::heartbeat:IPaddr2): Stopped
 ip-192.168.200.15 (ocf::heartbeat:IPaddr2): Stopped
 Docker container set: haproxy-bundle [192.168.0.1:8787/rhosp12/openstack-haproxy-docker:pcmklatest]
   haproxy-bundle-docker-0 (ocf::heartbeat:docker): FAILED (blocked)[ overcloud-controller-0 overcloud-controller-2 overcloud-controller-1 ]
   haproxy-bundle-docker-1 (ocf::heartbeat:docker): FAILED (blocked)[ overcloud-controller-0 overcloud-controller-2 overcloud-controller-1 ]
   haproxy-bundle-docker-2 (ocf::heartbeat:docker): FAILED (blocked)[ overcloud-controller-0 overcloud-controller-2 overcloud-controller-1 ]
 openstack-cinder-volume (systemd:openstack-cinder-volume): Started overcloud-controller-0

Failed Actions:
* rabbitmq-bundle-docker-0_stop_0 on overcloud-controller-0 'unknown error' (1): call=93, status=Timed Out, exitreason='none',
    last-rc-change='Fri Nov 17 13:55:35 2017', queued=0ms, exec=20023ms
* rabbitmq-bundle-docker-1_stop_0 on overcloud-controller-0 'unknown error' (1): call=94, status=Timed Out, exitreason='none',
    last-rc-change='Fri Nov 17 13:55:35 2017', queued=0ms, exec=20037ms
* galera-bundle-docker-0_stop_0 on overcloud-controller-0 'unknown error' (1): call=96, status=Timed Out, exitreason='none',
    last-rc-change='Fri Nov 17 13:55:35 2017', queued=0ms, exec=20035ms

We fix this by adding the docker service to
resource-agents-deps.target.wants which is the recommended method to
make sure non pacemaker managed resources come up before pacemaker
during a start and get stopped after pacemaker's service stop:
https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_enterprise_linux/7/html/high_availability_add-on_reference/s1-nonpacemakerstartup-haar

We conditionalize this change when docker is enabled and we also
make sure that we make the change only after the docker package
is installed, in order to cover split stack deployments as well.

With this change we were able to restart nodes without
observing any timeouts during stop or stopped resources
at startup.

Co-Authored-By: Damien Ciabrini <dciabrin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Added test suite and case to cover 'availability zone'

This was required to test advanced scenarios.

* Added a new 'admin' folder in 'scenario' folder
  to test advanced operations.

* Added a new file to the 'admin' folder that contains
  test cases for floating ip with admin privileges.

* Added a scenario test that verify valid connection
  between two instances on a single compute node
  using availability-zone.

* Changed 'base.py' to enable booting an instance with
  admin privileges.

Change-Id: I711a10eef321622c335e35b84e386b01d73b938a

[{'created': '2017-11-18 02:05:00.000000000', 'message': 'placement: Document `in:` prefix for ?member_of=

The documentation for the member_of query parameter for GET
/resource_providers [1] claims that it accepts a "comma-separated list
of strings representing aggregate uuids".  But it turns out the code [2]
is expecting a single UUID unless the prefix 'in:' is specified.

This change set updates the documentation accordingly.

[1] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/placement/#resource-providers
[2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/57728836f25e9201ddec1e7790b552cfa840d572/nova/api/openstack/placement/handlers/resource_provider.py#L229-L233

Change-Id: I2ec46d767ded5be02cfc73136f2d217f1347662a
Closes-Bug: #1733030
'}]
commit_message:
placement: Document `in:` prefix for ?member_of=

The documentation for the member_of query parameter for GET
/resource_providers [1] claims that it accepts a "comma-separated list
of strings representing aggregate uuids".  But it turns out the code [2]
is expecting a single UUID unless the prefix 'in:' is specified.

This change set updates the documentation accordingly.

[1] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/placement/#resource-providers
[2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/57728836f25e9201ddec1e7790b552cfa840d572/nova/api/openstack/placement/handlers/resource_provider.py#L229-L233

Change-Id: I2ec46d767ded5be02cfc73136f2d217f1347662a
Closes-Bug: #1733030

Fix passing props for ToolbarFiltersForm

It is necessary to be explicit here with specifying props as redux-form
passes large number of additional props to the wrapped component which
causes react to complain

commit_message:
Remove kwarg retry_on_request in wrap_db_retry

As Retry on request is always enabled, so the kwarg retry_on_request is
deprecated for removal.

Change-Id: I9c918828ce9f7075a4e33a6fbadd9613c81fa2eb
Closes-Bug: #1714440

commit_message:
Migrate charm to work with Python3 only

Various changes to migrate the charm to work with Python 3.  The tox.ini
has been modified to inlcude py35 and py36 targets for testing against
Python 3.5 (xenial, zesty), and Python 3.6 (artful+).

Change-Id: I009de528428aaca555b49f3fc17704dcf5f2a28c

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-08 15:37:41.000000000', 'message': 'Rename Undercloud->External deployment

These plays are better named External deployment instead of Undercloud
deployment, as they aren't actually deploying the Undercloud. It's
confusing to see "Undercloud deployment" and "Overcloud deployment"
tasks in the same output when the undercloud is already deployed.

As the tasks are driving external deployments, and that's what the Heat
output is called (external_deploy_steps_tasks), this renames them to
External deployment.

Change-Id: I685d16d8b3dc5e0d59955ae4c8fac7410168d083
'}]
commit_message:
Rename Undercloud->External deployment

These plays are better named External deployment instead of Undercloud
deployment, as they aren't actually deploying the Undercloud. It's
confusing to see "Undercloud deployment" and "Overcloud deployment"
tasks in the same output when the undercloud is already deployed.

As the tasks are driving external deployments, and that's what the Heat
output is called (external_deploy_steps_tasks), this renames them to
External deployment.

Change-Id: I685d16d8b3dc5e0d59955ae4c8fac7410168d083

commit_message:
fs010: remove legacy config-download parameters

commit_message:
Clarify composable services docs

This references CustomController, but in fact composable services and
override of the default service list works fine for the built in
default roles, so clarify this by just referencing the ControllerServices.

Change-Id: I5aa8e5542f19d9a04e0d68f4bb543e68f5801391

The "Customizing ceph.conf with ceph-ansible" section of the
documentation shows examples of using CephAnsibleExtraConfig
and CephConfigOverrides and it's a given that they should be
in environment files under parameter_defaults but rather than
assume the reader knows this, explicitly add parameter_defaults

commit_message:
Add parameter_defaults to Ceph example snippets

The "Customizing ceph.conf with ceph-ansible" section of the
documentation shows examples of using CephAnsibleExtraConfig
and CephConfigOverrides and it's a given that they should be
in environment files under parameter_defaults but rather than
assume the reader knows this, explicitly add parameter_defaults
so that the examples could be copied/pasted into and work without
modification.

Change-Id: I037cf3e6b37ca705853567e4dc9e80fe0e05efe7

messages:
[{'account_id': 7385, 'date': '2017-11-20 09:52:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7385, 'date': '2017-11-20 09:52:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

check experimental'}, {'account_id': 7385, 'date': '2017-11-20 13:10:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 7385, 'date': '2017-11-20 13:14:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7385, 'date': '2017-11-20 13:15:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

check experimental'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2017-11-20 15:13:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck purge_deleted race'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2017-11-20 15:18:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

I prefer this patch over Ic9a447f27e8c51f91f47f93b0fd1e9710341ec38. It appears the experimental jobs are failing on something unrelated (pre-flight validations by the looks of it), but it would be nice to see this passing before we commit to it.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2017-11-20 15:58:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

So it turned out the URL was signed only for PUT, but we need to use it for HEAD as well.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2017-11-20 16:08:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

According to https://www.swiftstack.com/blog/2015/01/29/swift-feature-highlight-tempurls/ "Note that HEAD is allowed if GET, PUT, or POST is allowed."

So just using HEAD would solve the problem.'}, {'account_id': 7385, 'date': '2017-11-20 16:09:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 7385, 'date': '2017-11-20 16:10:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

check experimental'}, {'account_id': 7385, 'date': '2017-11-20 16:54:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 7385, 'date': '2017-11-20 16:54:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

check experimental'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2017-11-20 18:06:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2017-11-20 21:40:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)

That looks better. FWIW, logs show that we didn't actually hit this race yet, in your patch or mine."}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2017-11-21 00:36:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

This would work for the undercloud swift which is single node, but I've regarded swift as an eventually consistent store, and I would assume that on a big swift cluster its possible that results from 'head' calls could flap until the cluster converges. If this is the case, I don't think this style of locking can be implemented over swift.

I could be wrong though, some clarification would be good."}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2017-11-21 10:03:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

I would probably agree with stevebaker's concern that swift temp_url thing is probably not the best thing. Let's see if it helps fix the current issues. May be using zaqar (not backed by swift) would be a better option?"}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2017-11-21 14:35:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> This would work for the undercloud swift which is single node, but I've regarded swift as an eventually consistent store, and I would assume that on a big swift cluster its possible that results from 'head' calls could flap until the cluster converges.

Yes. I don't know about flapping, but it's eventually consistent.

> If this is the case, I don't think this style of locking can be implemented over swift.

It can. You either get the latest value or an old value for the etags. If you get the latest value then you'll be checking the right thing, and if you get an old value you'll be trying again (whether you really needed to or not). Either way, you will end up with the latest data in Swift at the end of it all."}]

commit_message:
Check swift deployments before update

Before making a software deployments update in the Swift backend, check
the data content to operate as a transaction.

Change-Id: I58d3af3d1de481b3d314313c9f39255504792634
Closes-Bug: #1731032

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-21 09:42:33.000000000', 'message': "Template api/registry enablement settings properly

If a deployer sets the boolean vars to 'yes', 'no' or
other equivalent booleans valid for ansible, the glance
services will currently use those in the .conf files
and it will break.

This patch ensures that we cast the output into the
.conf files properly so that regardless of the input,
the output is correct.

The tests are adjusted to deliberately use one of the
Ansible boolean values instead of a python boolean to
validate that this works.

Change-Id: I267b97da618bbda05140d2a0332798fc77db06a5
"}]
commit_message:
Template api/registry enablement settings properly

If a deployer sets the boolean vars to 'yes', 'no' or
other equivalent booleans valid for ansible, the glance
services will currently use those in the .conf files
and it will break.

This patch ensures that we cast the output into the
.conf files properly so that regardless of the input,
the output is correct.

The tests are adjusted to deliberately use one of the
Ansible boolean values instead of a python boolean to
validate that this works.

Change-Id: I267b97da618bbda05140d2a0332798fc77db06a5

commit_message:
Remove tripleo-ci legacy jobs from heat

We now adopt new job `tripleo-ci-centos-7-ovb-ha-oooq`, and we should
remove `legacy-tripleo-ci-centos-7-nonha-multinode-oooq and
`legacy-tripleo-ci-centos-7-ovb-convergence-oooq` since we don't seems
to need it.

Also propose to remove `experimental-tripleo-jobs` from heat. Which
means `legacy-tripleo-ci-centos-7-ovb-fakeha-caserver` job and
`legacy-tripleo-ci-centos-7-ovb-ha-tempest-oooq` job.

Depends-On: bbcbbcc2e1429ee894588bf76449b6ed7e3f5392
Change-Id: Icbd092ef89c6a8e6f718e8ca68f2df63eb8dcbb4

kubernetes 4.0 broke our CI, let's see if patch that we depend on fixes
it.

subject: bagpipe-bgp, EVPN: clear the proxy ARP entry only if needed
messages: [{'account_id': 12021, 'date': '2017-11-21 10:33:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12021, 'date': '2017-11-21 12:35:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-21 10:33:19.000000000', 'message': 'bagpipe-bgp, EVPN: clear the proxy ARP entry only if needed

The ARP proxy clearup was always done, including in the context
where no entry had been programmed, which happens in the case
of a EVPN MAC route without an IP specified.

Change-Id: Ifb1ddd39e56e60a54cbec4d336d718187de7daac
'}]
commit_message:
bagpipe-bgp, EVPN: clear the proxy ARP entry only if needed

The ARP proxy clearup was always done, including in the context
where no entry had been programmed, which happens in the case
of a EVPN MAC route without an IP specified.

Change-Id: Ifb1ddd39e56e60a54cbec4d336d718187de7daac

commit_message:
update rpm requirements for the undercloud install

This updates the rpm requirements for the intial
undercloud deployment.  These changes should
be reflected in the dependencies for
python-tripleoclient.

Related-Bug: #1733381
Change-Id: Ia579bb239c125e53dfa1c24d98acb1ccd6caa410

Set debug in unbound only if config file exists

In CI reproducers unbound config files could not exist, so
check before changing them.

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-15 14:31:23.000000000', 'message': "Remove too opinionated parameters from kubernetes.yaml environment

The settings being removed are remnants from early days of testing.

The flavor settings can directly conflict/confuse deployments with
quickstart, as the flavors are called oooq_control and oooq_compute
instead, and we shouldn't really need to set them here.

The ComputeServices setting will start breaking deployments as soon as
we want to deploy any APBs on the compute nodes.

Change-Id: I68d958a408594b169bd9bb09607f04c180f915b9
"}]
commit_message:
Remove too opinionated parameters from kubernetes.yaml environment

The settings being removed are remnants from early days of testing.

The flavor settings can directly conflict/confuse deployments with
quickstart, as the flavors are called oooq_control and oooq_compute
instead, and we shouldn't really need to set them here.

The ComputeServices setting will start breaking deployments as soon as
we want to deploy any APBs on the compute nodes.

Change-Id: I68d958a408594b169bd9bb09607f04c180f915b9

commit_message:
Stream the Ansible output to a Zaqar queue

In order to get a the 'real-time' log of the ansible execution through
mistral, we need to stream the output in a Zaqar queue and then
consume it in the CLI

Closes-Bug: 1732497 Co-Authored-By: mathieu bultel <mat.bultel@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I65f774ff5a63bb0e7bbaeef0f41f2ac8a34934b4

commit_message:
doc: Switch to openstackdocstheme

The oslosphinx theme has been deprecated. Besides, we're currently
inconsistent with the other project docs themes.

Change-Id: I6a7a105d8b689ff5e5ca2f7829ce06d166e8db2e

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-15 20:41:56.000000000', 'message': "Add a note about versioned notification samples being per-release

The example versioned notifications don't have any indication of
which release they are available in, and since people can link to
the 'latest' docs, like in I51d0deffc4f42ff2722a8d21aa6b8c8008c62723,
it's important to note that the samples in the latest docs might not
be in the version of nova one is actually using, e.g. ocata or pike.

So this adds a note that people should be aware of that before
relying on some versioned notification.

Change-Id: I2f7db424f0938667895b51f45ea60862a32e22c1
"}, {'created': '2017-11-15 20:42:06.000000000', 'message': "Add a note about versioned notification samples being per-release

which release they are available in, and since people can link to
the 'latest' docs, like in I51d0deffc4f42ff2722a8d21aa6b8c8008c62723,
it's important to note that the samples in the latest docs might not
be in the version of nova one is actually using, e.g. ocata or pike.

So this adds a note that people should be aware of that before
relying on some versioned notification.

Change-Id: I2f7db424f0938667895b51f45ea60862a32e22c1
"}]
commit_message:
Add a note about versioned notification samples being per-release

The example versioned notifications don't have any indication of
which release they are available in, and since people can link to
the 'latest' docs, like in I51d0deffc4f42ff2722a8d21aa6b8c8008c62723,
it's important to note that the samples in the latest docs might not
be in the version of nova one is actually using, e.g. ocata or pike.

So this adds a note that people should be aware of that before
relying on some versioned notification.

Change-Id: I2f7db424f0938667895b51f45ea60862a32e22c1

commit_message:
Document the real behavior of notify_on_state_change

The documentation of the notify_on_state_change config param was
incomplete and misleading. The code is untouched since
2012 so the document is updated to reflect the current behavior.

Change-Id: I51d0deffc4f42ff2722a8d21aa6b8c8008c62723
Closes-Bug: #1535254

commit_message:
Using --option ARGUMENT

The OpenStack CLI commands support both --option ARGUMENT and --option=ARGUMENT.
In technical publications, use --option ARGUMENT.[1]

[1]https://docs.openstack.org/doc-contrib-guide/writing-style/code-conventions.html

Change-Id: Ifbf44c2bd9d7bec9308c6fb2c0340fb48811a653

commit_message:
Set --ntp-server without having to edit extra_args

Even basic HA deployments require --ntp-server to be passed in, so
this is something that Quickstart should support more natively than by
editing extra_args.

Change-Id: I1359e9f4ff3e294e2e56f5eb4c676c3be63dbe95
Closes-Bug: #1729271

commit_message:
Fix _parse_block_device to return (str, int)

_parse_block_device was returning inconsistent types. This seems
to have been working by accident under py2 but fails for py3.

This change fixes _parse_block_device to always returns (str, int)

Closes-Bug: #1732413
Change-Id: If0bfb4030ab9acfdf599ef8e70fed14816df3e26

commit_message:
Add config sample to networking-hyperv docs

This change adds an automatically generated config sample to the
networking-hyperv docs.

The config sample is generated each time the docs are built, using
the oslo.config sphinxconfiggen extension.

Change-Id: Id8fa0311d653a438b143018f032e32d3eb6bbaa8
Related-Bug: #1731491

[{'account_id': 8108, 'date': '2017-11-13 07:23:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2424, 'date': '2017-11-13 15:13:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Considering there are many options in LAUNCH_INSTANCE_DEFAULTS that user may want to tweak, we should probably expose a config option that allows users to do it, for example:

juju config openstach-dashboard launch-instance-defaults="create_volume=True"
juju config openstach-dashboard launch-instance-defaults="create_volume=True,enable_scheduler_hints=False"

James, what do you think?'}, {'account_id': 20635, 'date': '2017-11-14 19:03:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@ Felipe - I actually disagree with your reservation on this.  With charms, we are more about modeling profiles than exposing 1:1 config options.'}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2017-11-14 20:13:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Agree with @beisner. I'd vote for creating a different config option for enable_scheduler_hints if that's needed."}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2017-11-14 20:15:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Seems like the config description could align better with upsteam's description."}, {'account_id': 8108, 'date': '2017-11-15 01:23:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8108, 'date': '2017-11-15 01:25:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

ack ;)'}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2017-11-15 14:04:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

commit_message:
Allow to override the default volume creation behavior

Now that Horizon upstream added the ability to configure the default
"create volume" value when launching an instance (See. LP: #1678109),
expose it as a new charm config.

Change-Id: I68a6f199a72c11ad4eff2b587cb4279c91da52ae
Closes-Bug: #1711342

messages:
[{'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2017-11-20 19:56:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2017-11-20 19:58:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 6449, 'date': '2017-11-20 20:00:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 9257, 'date': '2017-11-20 20:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2017-11-21 06:49:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2017-11-21 06:57:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Oh boy this even more broken. Even this snippet:
    - debug: var=(outputs.stderr|default('')).split('\n')|union(outputs.stdout_lines|default([]))
      when: outputs is defined
      failed_when: outputs.rc != 0


Is broken because if the previous step that registered 'outputs' is skipped, 'outputs' is still defined as:
{'skip_reason': u'Conditional result was False', 'skipped': True, 'changed': False}"}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2017-11-21 07:07:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2017-11-21 07:10:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 13039, 'date': '2017-11-21 09:48:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2017-11-21 10:09:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

That's so wierd. Shall we now fix |failed |succeeded et al literally *everywhere*?.."}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2017-11-21 11:04:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> That's so wierd. Shall we now fix |failed |succeeded et al
 > literally *everywhere*?..

> So because we use failed_when: false when registering the variable then we
> can't use the 'failed' filter? This is sneaky.                            

I think so yes because when we set failed_when: false the outputs
variable has this:
 "msg": "outputs: {'stderr_lines': [], u'cmd': u'echo \"fail 1\"\\n exit 2',
 u'end': u'2017-11-21 11:04:53.726338', u'stdout': u'fail 1',
 u'changed': True, u'rc': 2, u'failed': False, u'stderr': u'', u'delta':
 u'0:00:00.002942', u'msg': u'non-zero return code', 'stdout_lines':
 [u'fail 1'], 'failed_when_result': False, u'start': u'2017-11-21
 11:04:53.723396'}"

So 'failed' will simply stay false and never be true.


Which other places did you have in mind? I did a quick grep, but only on the failed stuff'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-20 19:56:37.000000000', 'message': 'Fix all outputs|failed calls

The ansible "failed_when" filter that uses a registered output
of a previous task piped to the '|failed' filter does not work
as expected. Given the following playbook:

  - name: return code
    shell: |
      echo "fail 2"
      exit 2
    failed_when: false
    log_when: false
    register: outputs
  - debug:
      msg: "rc: {{ outputs.rc }}"
  - debug: msg="Broken (does not fail as expected)"
    when: outputs is defined
    failed_when: outputs|failed
  - debug: msg="Working (fails as expected)"
    when: outputs is defined
    failed_when: outputs.rc != 0

We obtain the following output:

TASK [return code] ****
changed: [localhost]

TASK [debug] **********
ok: [localhost] => {
    "msg": "rc: 2"
}

TASK [debug] **********
ok: [localhost] => {
    "failed_when_result": false,
    "msg": "Broken (does not fail as expected)"
}

TASK [debug] **********
fatal: [localhost]: FAILED! => {
    "failed_when_result": true,
    "msg": "Working (fails as expected)"
}

This means that the 'outputs|failed' just does not work at all.
Let's move to a more explicit check on the rc code of the registered
variable.

Change-Id: I6ef53dc3f9aede42f10c7f110d24722355481261
'}, {'created': '2017-11-20 19:58:03.000000000', 'message': 'Fix all outputs|failed calls

as expected. Given the following playbook:

  - name: return code

  - debug:

  - debug: msg="Broken (does not fail as expected)"
    when: outputs is defined
    failed_when: outputs|failed
  - debug: msg="Working (fails as expected)"
    when: outputs is defined
    failed_when: outputs.rc != 0

We obtain the following output:

TASK [return code] ****
changed: [localhost]

TASK [debug] **********
ok: [localhost] => {
    "msg": "rc: 2"
}

TASK [debug] **********
ok: [localhost] => {

Change-Id: I6ef53dc3f9aede42f10c7f110d24722355481261
'}, {'created': '2017-11-21 07:07:39.000000000', 'message': 'Fix all outputs|failed and outputs is defined

The ansible "failed_when" filter that uses a registered output
of a previous task piped to the '|failed' filter does not work
as expected. Given the following playbook:

  - name: return code
    shell: |
      echo "fail 2"
      exit 2
    failed_when: false
    log_when: false
    register: outputs
  - debug:
      msg: "rc: {{ outputs.rc }}"
  - debug: msg="Broken (does not fail as expected)"
    when: outputs is defined
    failed_when: outputs|failed
  - debug: msg="Working (fails as expected)"
    when: outputs is defined
    failed_when: outputs.rc != 0

We obtain the following output:

TASK [return code] ****
changed: [localhost]

TASK [debug] **********
ok: [localhost] => {
    "msg": "rc: 2"
}

TASK [debug] **********
ok: [localhost] => {
    "failed_when_result": false,
    "msg": "Broken (does not fail as expected)"
}

TASK [debug] **********
fatal: [localhost]: FAILED! => {
    "failed_when_result": true,
    "msg": "Working (fails as expected)"
}

This means that the 'outputs|failed' just does not work at all.
Let's move to a more explicit check on the rc code of the registered
variable.

We also need to fix all the "outputs is defined" checks, because
when a task is skipped the registered outputs variable *is* actually
defined as the following dictionary:
{'skip_reason': u'Conditional result was False', 'skipped': True, 'changed': False}

So we use "outputs.rc is defined" in order to make sure that the
previous task did indeed run.

Closes-Bug: #1733402

Change-Id: I6ef53dc3f9aede42f10c7f110d24722355481261
'}]
commit_message:
Fix all outputs|failed and outputs is defined

The ansible "failed_when" filter that uses a registered output
of a previous task piped to the '|failed' filter does not work
as expected. Given the following playbook:

  - name: return code
    shell: |
      echo "fail 2"
      exit 2
    failed_when: false
    log_when: false
    register: outputs
  - debug:
      msg: "rc: {{ outputs.rc }}"
  - debug: msg="Broken (does not fail as expected)"
    when: outputs is defined
    failed_when: outputs|failed
  - debug: msg="Working (fails as expected)"
    when: outputs is defined
    failed_when: outputs.rc != 0

We obtain the following output:

TASK [return code] ****
changed: [localhost]

TASK [debug] **********
ok: [localhost] => {
    "msg": "rc: 2"
}

TASK [debug] **********
ok: [localhost] => {
    "failed_when_result": false,
    "msg": "Broken (does not fail as expected)"
}

TASK [debug] **********
fatal: [localhost]: FAILED! => {
    "failed_when_result": true,
    "msg": "Working (fails as expected)"
}

This means that the 'outputs|failed' just does not work at all.
Let's move to a more explicit check on the rc code of the registered
variable.

We also need to fix all the "outputs is defined" checks, because
when a task is skipped the registered outputs variable *is* actually
defined as the following dictionary:
{'skip_reason': u'Conditional result was False', 'skipped': True, 'changed': False}

So we use "outputs.rc is defined" in order to make sure that the
previous task did indeed run.

Closes-Bug: #1733402

Change-Id: I6ef53dc3f9aede42f10c7f110d24722355481261

commit_message:
Fix `create_pod` for 4.0 kubernetes client

4.0 version of kubernetes pypi package was released. It changes the
V1Container and V1PodSpec parameter validation and now requires name and
containers fields respectively to always be provided to the
constructors. This commit fixes that.

A successful run of the fix agains kuryr-kubernetes repo can be seen on
Ie282feac157f454b61fd259a3e122fbf97199950.

Closes-Bug: 1733538
Change-Id: I96d2ad16033fa0ebac0f97b0f7d28ed3f933e227

commit_message:
zuul.d: jobs.yaml: Restore voting status of openSUSE jobs

The OpenStack mirrors are now using an alternative openSUSE mirror
to sync so package and metadata states should be in a good state again.
As such, restore the voting status of the job.

Change-Id: I9726ec6b882e3106bbb2cf38a68ba7735cde036e

commit_message:
Install libvirt-clients for nova-libvirt image

libvirt-clients is nice to have, which is helpful for operator.

Change-Id: I892eebf542ee624e275c215809a3f1a9e6ab3135
Closes-Bug: #1720051

It would be nice to add a test for this issue (I think no concurrency would be needed in the test - just mocking delete_instance method to raise an exception and check if quota changes).

I think this should fix *most* of race delete requests, but it won't catch "force-deleted" shares. I wonder if distributed locking should be used?'}, {'account_id': 15100, 'date': '2017-08-09 07:39:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 15100, 'date': '2017-08-09 08:01:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@Jan Provaznik, Good catch! Thanks for review

I think this should fix *most* of race delete requests, but it won't catch "force-deleted" shares. 
-- yes, it won't catch "force-deleted" shares.

I wonder if distributed locking should be used?
-- It could be used, since I added distributed locking, it still have the same problem. Because we have two places to delete share record in db. We delete share in manila-api and manila-share service. 
1. We delete share record in db in manila-api  -- the bug can be fix
2. We delete share record in db in manila-share -- if we added distributed locking in manila-api, we can not control the manila-share service. If there is some wrong when we delete share instance in share service, the share record still in db, and we cannot summit -1 shares quota in db. 
So the key point it could be we should remove the quota change to the place that the share db record has been deleted.
If we don't add distributed locking when we delete share instance in manila-share service, we can also got NotFound error from delete share instance in db when we delete one share many times in the same time. (because we can only delete share instance one time in db)Then we can not continue to summit -1 share quotas and got right quota usage values. 
If I missing something, please point it out again. thanks.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-08-09 08:49:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified+1

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-01 07:08:44.000000000', 'message': "Fix quota error in batch delete shares

We got quota -1 many times when we delete the
same share many times in the same time. Because
we didn't change share status to deleting before
we reserve -1 quotas, then we can reserve -1 quotas
many times for one share (currently, share status is
equal to available). So we record the wrong usage
quota(shares, gigabytes) value.

Now, we remove the quota reserve to the place that the
share status has been changed to deleting.

Closes-bug: 1707379
Change-Id: Idd0014d898d5468923625e62f9e649926dc04e24
"}, {'created': '2017-08-09 07:39:21.000000000', 'message': 'Fix quota error in batch delete shares

We record the wrong usage quota (shares, gigabytes) value
when we delete one share many times at the same time.
Because we reserve -1 shares quota before we delete the
share record in db, then we can continue to get share info
from db and reserve quota -1 many times.

Changed to remove the quota reserve to the place that after
the share record has been deleted in db.

Closes-bug: 1707379
Change-Id: Idd0014d898d5468923625e62f9e649926dc04e24

commit_message:
Fix quota error in batch delete shares

We record the wrong usage quota (shares, gigabytes) value
when we delete one share many times at the same time.
Because we reserve -1 shares quota before we delete the
share record in db, then we can continue to get share info
from db and reserve quota -1 many times.

Changed to remove the quota reserve to the place that after
the share record has been deleted in db.

Closes-bug: 1707379
Change-Id: Idd0014d898d5468923625e62f9e649926dc04e24

commit_message:
Implement testing using tempest

Rather than the previous basic functional tests, this
implements the use of tempest to exercise the API's
properly to validate that they're working properly.

Included is the normalisation of the way the upgrade
test is implemented to make it exactly in line with
the way the original API upgrade test was implemented
in the keystone repository. This keeps it consistent.

Change-Id: Id491d018beb30bce748240b50e9d66dcc1a249fa

apache_site_config_for is a shell function, not a shell variable.
Shell syntax for functions is ().  Variables use {}.

commit_message:
Fix typo in trovestack cleanup

apache_site_config_for is a shell function, not a shell variable.
Shell syntax for functions is ().  Variables use {}.

Change-Id: Ia9a35cdb0883f576efe584bc854de94072e13b87

[{'created': '2017-07-11 11:20:42.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: SR-IOV support

'}, {'created': '2017-07-24 14:37:56.000000000', 'message': 'Adds SR-IOV support

SR-IOV support has been added to Hyper-V since Windows / Hyper-V
Server 2012.

In order to properly use SR-IOV, the host must support it, and have it
enabled, and it must have SR-IOV capable NICs.

The Hyper-V vSwitches will have to be configured to enable SR-IOV.

vmutils: create_nic - mac_address can now be None. If None,
a dynamic address will be used instead.
hostuils: added get_nic_sriov_vfs - returns a list of dictionaries,
containing available vSwitch VFs.
networkutils: added set_vswitch_port_sriov - enables / disables SR-IOV
on the given switch port.

Implements: blueprint os-win-sriov

Change-Id: Ied27bb4e1b36e743b33c6b65351c2ee942ef535e

commit_message:
Adds SR-IOV support

SR-IOV support has been added to Hyper-V since Windows / Hyper-V
Server 2012.

In order to properly use SR-IOV, the host must support it, and have it
enabled, and it must have SR-IOV capable NICs.

The Hyper-V vSwitches will have to be configured to enable SR-IOV.

vmutils: create_nic - mac_address can now be None. If None,
a dynamic address will be used instead.
hostuils: added get_nic_sriov_vfs - returns a list of dictionaries,
containing available vSwitch VFs.
networkutils: added set_vswitch_port_sriov - enables / disables SR-IOV
on the given switch port.

Implements: blueprint os-win-sriov

Change-Id: Ied27bb4e1b36e743b33c6b65351c2ee942ef535e

commit_message:
Reload nginx during syncs

Instead of stopping nginx during a sync of repository files, temporarily
disable the openstack-slushee site. This friendlier behavior will allow
for the repo server to share a web server with other sites and services.

Change-Id: I95cbd104d948f51cbff6a8396d1ba115ad99d7c6

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-18 12:20:01.000000000', 'message': 'Allow deployment without glance-registry

The glance v1 API is deprecated and intended to be removed
from the glance code within the Queens or Rocky cycles.

When using the glance v2 API the glance-registry service is
optional, and the intention is to remove the glance-registry
service in the S cycle. The glance-registry service is required
when using the v1 API though.

Furthermore, when using the glance-registry service it is not
possible to execute a rolling upgrade without losing API
transactions.

Given the above information, this patch enables the deployment
of glance with only the v2 API enabled, and without the
glance-registry service. It adds a per-commit test to validate
that this configuration works.

Change-Id: Ie95daed286798d139f0a35ffdd2a4dd1cdda6ff9

'}, {'created': '2017-11-20 11:16:44.000000000', 'message': 'Allow deployment without glance-registry

The glance v1 API is deprecated and intended to be removed
from the glance code within the Queens or Rocky cycles.

When using the glance v2 API the glance-registry service is
optional, and the intention is to remove the glance-registry
service in the S cycle. The glance-registry service is required
when using the v1 API though.

Furthermore, when using the glance-registry service it is not
possible to execute a rolling upgrade without losing API
transactions.

Given the above information, this patch enables the deployment
of glance with only the v2 API enabled, and without the
glance-registry service. It adds a per-commit test to validate
that this configuration works.

This patch also corrects a previous misconfiguration which
enabled the v2 registry service, but did not set the data_api
correctly with it.

The glance_enable_v1_registry variable is also removed as it
is meaningless. The v1 API *requires* the registry to be
enabled, so we just enable it if glance_enable_v1_api is
enabled.

Change-Id: Ie95daed286798d139f0a35ffdd2a4dd1cdda6ff9

Given the above information, this patch enables the deployment
of glance with only the v2 API enabled, and without the
glance-registry service. It adds a per-commit test to validate
that this configuration works.

This patch also corrects a previous misconfiguration which
enabled the v2 registry service, but did not set the data_api
correctly for the API service to inform it that the registry
was operating.

The glance_enable_v1_registry variable is also removed as it
is meaningless. The v1 API *requires* the registry to be
enabled, so we just enable it if glance_enable_v1_api is
enabled.

Change-Id: Ie95daed286798d139f0a35ffdd2a4dd1cdda6ff9
'}]
commit_message:
Allow deployment without glance-registry

The glance v1 API is deprecated and intended to be removed
from the glance code within the Queens or Rocky cycles.

When using the glance v2 API the glance-registry service is
optional, and the intention is to remove the glance-registry
service in the S cycle. The glance-registry service is required
when using the v1 API though.

Furthermore, when using the glance-registry service it is not
possible to execute a rolling upgrade without losing API
transactions.

Given the above information, this patch enables the deployment
of glance with only the v2 API enabled, and without the
glance-registry service. It adds a per-commit test to validate
that this configuration works.

This patch also corrects a previous misconfiguration which
enabled the v2 registry service, but did not set the data_api
correctly for the API service to inform it that the registry
was operating.

The glance_enable_v1_registry variable is also removed as it
is meaningless. The v1 API *requires* the registry to be
enabled, so we just enable it if glance_enable_v1_api is
enabled.

Change-Id: Ie95daed286798d139f0a35ffdd2a4dd1cdda6ff9

commit_message:
Disable glance-registry and the v1 API by default

When using the glance v2 API the glance-registry service is
optional, and the intention is to remove the glance-registry
service in the S cycle.

The glance v1 API is scheduled to be removed in Queens.
This patch therefore disables the v1 API by default to give
us as much time as possible to identify the impact of that
and to get the issues resolved before it is removed from
the code-base.

The patch also cleans up the glance-registry init files
to handle the transition in an existing environment.

Tests are added to validate that enabling the v1 API still
works, and enabling the v2 registry still works.

Change-Id: I4c27aa0ca5b649e4fa76cfd0f326d80f50074db1

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-30 16:42:25.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Adds metrics collection scenario

This test suite verifies that the instance metrics are properly published
and collected and have non-zero values. The verification is done via the
ceilometer API.

Waiting for the ceilometer compute agent to poll the resources is crucial,
otherwise the test suite will fail due to the fact that no samples would
be found published before checking the samples.

The ceilometer agent's polling interval should have the same value as
the test suite's polled_metric_delay. This can be done in two ways:
a. Configure tempest's polled_metric_delay, by adding the following
line in tempest.conf, in the telemetry section:
    polled_metric_delay = <desired value>
b. Set the interval value in pipeline.yaml on the compute node to the
desired value and restart the ceilometer compute agent.

The second method is preferred, as the interval value defined in
pipeline.yaml is 600 seconds, which would mean each test would last
at least 10 minutes.

Change-Id: I2ad696c221fba860a30621686b464b8486bea583
"}, {'created': '2017-09-08 15:30:52.000000000', 'message': "Adds metrics collection scenario

be found published before checking the samples.

The ceilometer agent's polling interval should have the same value as
the test suite's polled_metric_delay. This can be done in two ways:
a. Configure tempest's polled_metric_delay, by adding the following
line in tempest.conf, in the telemetry section:
    polled_metric_delay = <desired value>
b. Set the interval value in pipeline.yaml on the compute node to the
desired value and restart the ceilometer compute agent.

The second method is preferred, as the interval value defined in
pipeline.yaml is 600 seconds, which would mean each test would last
at least 10 minutes.

Change-Id: I2ad696c221fba860a30621686b464b8486bea583

commit_message:
Adds metrics collection scenario

This test suite verifies that the instance metrics are properly published
and collected and have non-zero values. The verification is done via the
ceilometer API.

Waiting for the ceilometer compute agent to poll the resources is crucial,
otherwise the test suite will fail due to the fact that no samples would
be found published before checking the samples.

The ceilometer agent's polling interval should have the same value as
the test suite's polled_metric_delay. This can be done in two ways:
a. Configure tempest's polled_metric_delay, by adding the following
line in tempest.conf, in the telemetry section:
    polled_metric_delay = <desired value>
b. Set the interval value in pipeline.yaml on the compute node to the
desired value and restart the ceilometer compute agent.

The second method is preferred, as the interval value defined in
pipeline.yaml is 600 seconds, which would mean each test would last
at least 10 minutes.

Change-Id: I2ad696c221fba860a30621686b464b8486bea583

commit_message:
Remove v2 default variables

The v2 API was recently removed from keystone and these variables
haven't even been used within the role for several releases.

Change-Id: Ia5584d72b5886c7debf73b8f8d11f7ab9f4da436

commit_message:
allow server projects to be published to pypi by default

Update the default jobs allowed for a python service to include
publish-to-pypi, as we begin to publish more services there.

Change-Id: Ibf31c851205a0eed283a4f6bdc1cd6a8037dcd79
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-09-16 18:48:43.000000000', 'message': 'Add external LB management handler hook interface

Based on conversation on an ansible issue[1], I implemented
a LB orchestration role[2] similar to the POC here[3].

This will allow external loadbalancer management roles to hook
into a universal notify listener "Manage LB" to perform before/
after endpoint management actions when the service is being
restarted.

[1]: https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/27813
[2]: https://github.com/Logan2211/ansible-haproxy-endpoints

commit_message:
Add external LB management handler hook interface

Based on conversation on an ansible issue[1], I implemented
a LB orchestration role[2] similar to the POC here[3].

This will allow external loadbalancer management roles to hook
into a universal notify listener "Manage LB" to perform before/
after endpoint management actions when the service is being
restarted.

[1]: https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/27813
[2]: https://github.com/Logan2211/ansible-haproxy-endpoints
[3]: https://github.com/Logan2211/tmp-ansible-27813

Change-Id: I7d2f47e94826526e9a5a99d32575f691fb6b30fd

commit_message:
VMware: serial console log (completed)

Commit ace11d3 adds a serial port device to instances, so the serial
console output can be sent to a virtual serial port concentrator (VSPC).
This patch finishes the implementation by returning the output saved by
VSPC to the end user. The config option 'serial_log_dir' should have the
same value as in the VSPC configuration (i.e. it must point to the same
directory).

The VSPC implementation is available at
https://github.com/openstack/vmware-vspc

blueprint vmware-console-log-complete

Change-Id: I7e40dc41b0354d414bc8eae331f8257959e1d123

[{'created': '2017-11-18 12:56:20.000000000', 'message': 'Retry apt cache update

Retry apt cache update

This task is causing some test failures from time
to time. Implementing a retry should help to reduce
transient failures.

commit_message:
Added procedure to enable heat_policy.json.

After Heat relevant contents will split out from Horiozon,
I guess 'orchestration' key of POLICY_FILES settings will be
removed also.

So I've add procedure for adding this key
so that user can correctly enable heat_policy.json

Change-Id: I77ae6c6f63f5ae0f21e9aa6d33edca458bb17502

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-17 03:48:31.000000000', 'message': "Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html

Change-Id: I980ad3f6468e0d8d984c27d367bd6546f78ee113
"}]
commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html

Change-Id: I980ad3f6468e0d8d984c27d367bd6546f78ee113

messages:
[{'account_id': 26015, 'date': '2017-11-08 14:12:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2017-11-08 14:12:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 8213, 'date': '2017-11-13 14:13:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Change scheduler extra_spec schema

In before, extra_spec is populated by scheduler hints. This patch
move scheduler hints under key 'hints'. This allows extra_spec
to accommodate other information in the future.

Change-Id: Ia7507e1ffec66436acb0639422082b8b555341e0

This patch expands the 'delete_after_stop' to support following status:
[consts.RUNNING, consts.CREATED, consts.ERROR, consts.STOPPED, consts.DELETED],
and calls container_stop when container status is running.

Change-Id: I2d5105964f8ad6c08c537bd59f48cb5f04fe3afb

commit_message:
Support batch delete containers with different states

This patch expands the 'delete_after_stop' to support following status:
[consts.RUNNING, consts.CREATED, consts.ERROR, consts.STOPPED, consts.DELETED],
and calls container_stop when container status is running.

Change-Id: I2d5105964f8ad6c08c537bd59f48cb5f04fe3afb
Closes-Bug: #1733263

commit_message:
Add swift_config puppet tag to the dockerized proxy service

This ensures that the base class is applied, setting the required hash
values in swift.conf properly when deploying a proxy node without the
storage service at the same time.

Closes-Bug: 1732663
Depends-On: I11c044bbc8b9f56f95ace9320cc77303d9a7543e
Change-Id: Id916413c9d74071968d9988b604664fad30282b2

Hi iwamoto,

We've reproduced your usecase as bug #1708092. Indeed, this is problem with security group and logging feature also show exactly what happend in security group, more detail you can see test case8 at [1]. So logging feature is useful for us to detect issues in security group's implementation. Therefore, I think ovs fw logging implementation [2] is correct. Does that make sense to you?
[1] https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1i_HWzU2fl3LiRUUdP17D09JQwWTDNiSTmYmQf8ItWxk/edit?usp=sharing
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/468281/"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-08-10 12:25:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

commit_message:
ovsfw: Merge multiple conjunction flows

The ovsfw code generated multiple flows with the same or overlapping
match fields and different actions=conjunction(nnn,2/2) flows.
Merge such flows and generate only one flow with
actions=conjunction(mmm,2/2),conjunction(nnn,2/2) so that filtering
are correctly performed.

Change-Id: I0cd325b02f35e103606595b8b124010fff8dc397
Partial-bug: #1708092

commit_message:
Move install tasks into pre_tasks

Several install-time tasks are in the post install
tasks, mixed in with the config tasks.

This patch moves them to the pre_install task set
to make a clean break between pre/install/post
tasks and tidies up the tasks a little.

Change-Id: I12bceda01e747bc1c41925a7d4afeca8f7ce9d8e

commit_message:
Implement consistent restart handlers

Retries and daemon reloads are added to all the handlers
and the ordering of each task is set out according to
the same pattern as they keystone role.

Change-Id: Icc250e811fb89024f3f3c2f9520d1a6c9c21f0d3

commit_message:
Remove unused variable and handlers

The variable repo_auto_rebuild appears to have been
introduced in kilo, but never used.

The 'Init reload' handler is no longer required as
all services are now managed via systemd and the
service module.

The 'reload ssh' handler is also unused.

Change-Id: I1078ff7d2bd1acd0d1cea90fb90bc632386f0daf

commit_message:
Include swift base class in the proxy class

This was missing, and therefore the Swif hashes were not properly set in
swift.conf if only the proxy manifest was applied (for example when
deploying separate storage nodes).

Related-Bug: 1732663
Change-Id: I11c044bbc8b9f56f95ace9320cc77303d9a7543e
(cherry picked from commit 86df82502853b351a333d7787899dca11e64783e)

commit_message:
Resolve ansible-lint test failures

With the merge of https://review.openstack.org/520177 in the
tests repo some ansible-lint failures which previously were
not being picked up are now detected.

This adds the appropriate skip tags to the tasks so that they
are not evaluated by ansible-lint.

Change-Id: I820aa77ac097d4f3d043fb434255923847e3d650

Resolve ansible-lint test failures

With the merge of https://review.openstack.org/520177 in the
tests repo some ansible-lint failures which previously were
not being picked up are now detected.

are not evaluated by ansible-lint.

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-20 11:35:06.000000000', 'message': 'Correct the failed status in the baremetal workflow

Two tasks in the introspect workflow have incorrectly been sending
"ERROR" statuses when they should have sent "FAILED". This then meant
the workflow appeared to finish without errors (or failures). This is
primarily a problem for the introspect_manageable_nodes workflow which
then can't detect errors and reports that everything was successful.

Change-Id: I34a91dd14bb19775ad62271def6ecb66398c84db
Closes-Bug: #1733303
'}]
commit_message:
Correct the failed status in the baremetal workflow

Two tasks in the introspect workflow have incorrectly been sending
"ERROR" statuses when they should have sent "FAILED". This then meant
the workflow appeared to finish without errors (or failures). This is
primarily a problem for the introspect_manageable_nodes workflow which
then can't detect errors and reports that everything was successful.

Change-Id: I34a91dd14bb19775ad62271def6ecb66398c84db
Closes-Bug: #1733303

commit_message:
Make the cache prep timeout configurable

In some environments it may be desirable to adjust the
cache timeout. This makes that possible.

Change-Id: I733887f16d844f07457c80c3c6936f668e12ce86

[{'created': '2017-04-18 14:22:44.000000000', 'message': "Check failed cluster vm live migrations

At the moment, when migrating clustered instances, we only catch
HyperVVMNotFoundException exceptions, in which case we attempt to
recover the instance. For any other exception, the instance will
hang in a 'migrating' state.

This change checks the instance state, trying to recover if it's
not in an inconsistent state, setting it to 'error' state otherwise.

Depends-On: I6c268355213718d4d66e0e77a89c558cde3213b6

Closes-Bug: #1674438

Change-Id: I952122bc2f0386f68c0ad62d195cfc5d84648876

commit_message:
Check failed cluster vm live migrations

At the moment, when migrating clustered instances, we only catch
HyperVVMNotFoundException exceptions, in which case we attempt to
recover the instance. For any other exception, the instance will
hang in a 'migrating' state.

This change checks the instance state, trying to recover if it's
not in an inconsistent state, setting it to 'error' state otherwise.

Depends-On: I6c268355213718d4d66e0e77a89c558cde3213b6

Closes-Bug: #1674438

Change-Id: I952122bc2f0386f68c0ad62d195cfc5d84648876
(cherry picked from commit 96c21a6686bfb8534321b432640c4f6dc3abe5fe)

(14 comments)

-1 for the missing help messages on the arguments.

We should also have some TODOs in here about missing things like updating the inventory for a single resource class. Chris Dent also pointed out those PUTs in PS1. He makes a good point that doing PUT /resource_providers/{uuid}/inventories with more than one resource class would be difficult on the command line.

And DELETE /resource_provider/{uuid}/inventories is microversion 1.5 so we could hold off on implementing that for now, but we could leave a TODO in here so we don't forget about it.

You might also want to move the change that implements GET /resource_classes before this one, because it'd be nice to be able to list and create resource classes before working with inventories."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-10-11 19:40:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> You might also want to move the change that implements GET /resource_classes before this one, because it'd be nice to be able to list and create resource classes before working with inventories.

Sorry, I guess the resource_classes APIs require at least microversion 1.2 so until we support microversions in here that's going to be harder to move up front. I don't know what is going to be involved there, it seems we'd just make the request with the given microversion we know about, and we get a 405 back if it's not available."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-10-11 19:45:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> I don't know what is going to be involved there, it seems we'd just make the request with the given microversion we know about, and we get a 405 back if it's not available.

I guess you get a 404 response back actually if you request a microversion and it's not on the server:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/64635ad4a5f60a79e1ec2d5369a8f84bfeccb7e4/nova/api/openstack/placement/microversion.py#L238"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-10-11 22:53:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

what do you think?'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2017-10-24 14:12:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

> openstack resource provider inventory set <uuid> \
>                  VCPU=16 MEMORY_MB=2048 MEMORY_MB:step_size=128
> what do you think?

I like the idea of not having to say --resource for every entry.  But if --resource took multiple values (without repeating the opt), then the difference is negligible.'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2017-10-24 15:09:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

Andrey, OSC itself has a fairly strict stance on positional arguments, and I know of only a few exceptions to this (one of which was my own mistake): positional arguments are used to name the resource objects in the command itself, ie a 'server XXX' command only has the server name/ID as a positional; 'server add volume' only has the server name/ID and volume name/ID as positional arguments, etc.

Of course you are free to not adopt that policy here, but you will then be inconsistent with the rest of the OSC command set.

Eric, the repeated option pattern was established mostly because a) having an option accept n arguments (argparse's nargs) leads to ambiguities in parsing command lines, and/or b) limits the available syntax of those options to introduce separators and thus limit the characters usable in the arguments.  It also leads to things like osc-lib's rather ugly MultiKeyValueCommaAction which is only used one place (so far) and frankly is a usability mess.   I'd include it in the next UX study, if we could do more of those..."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2017-10-24 15:18:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Fair enough.  Thanks for the explanation.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-11-20 14:40:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-11-20 14:40:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

Overall this looks good. I'm going to pull it down to my devstack so I can play with it a bit."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-11-20 15:49:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2

(3 comments)

I'm good with this - thanks for the hard work on this one. I have some comments and suggestions inline, but we can fix those in a follow up patch."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-11-20 16:08:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-11-20 16:43:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

I'm fixing my comments here:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/521578/"}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2017-11-21 09:27:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

[{'created': '2017-11-16 19:52:25.000000000', 'message': "Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: I822799d34da3f4738c0e13538f8913401929a743
"}]
commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: I822799d34da3f4738c0e13538f8913401929a743

commit_message:
treats os-win exceptions

If a port dissapears while processing a port, some
os_win NotFound exceptions are raised. Catching them
and treating them will tidy up the logs.

NOTE(claudiub): hyperv_neutron_agent was refactored into the layer2 module
in master, resulting the conflict.

Conflicts:
        hyperv/neutron/agent/hyperv_neutron_agent.py
        hyperv/neutron/agent/layer2.py
        hyperv/tests/unit/neutron/agent/test_hyperv_neutron_agent.py
        hyperv/tests/unit/neutron/agent/test_layer2.py
        test-requirements.txt

Closes-Bug: #1684045

(cherry-picked from commit 1bd6e7047d30b79b1a808f97b904917c0d6ce146)
Change-Id: Id629251ca1addfac5c0c559085ff3d3d116c7b19

If there are multiple consumers for queues, what will happen?
The delta data will be flipped. Is there a good method to 
solve this problem?'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-11-20 06:13:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

recheck - releasenotes job fixed'}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2017-11-20 22:19:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2017-11-20 22:45:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

jazeltq, there are two scenarios:

if you have workload_partitioning disabled:
each worker has it's own consumer of all notification queues. they greedily grab, process, and then send to gnocchi (or whatever publishers are configured). in this case, your transformations will probably not work properly.

if workload_partitioning enabled:
all workers listen to main openstack queues and greedily hash the data into pipeline_queues. this in theory could get out of order since it's multithreaded but i imagine this is a rare scenario where you have very little data and a backed up main queue.

once it is hashed into pipeline queue. there is only ever one consumer on each of these queues. so whatever order the data is in in pipeline queue, that is the order it will be processed.

not sure if that answers your question. (i will add some notes in docs)"}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2017-11-21 00:37:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 12484, 'date': '2017-11-21 09:04:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

 > 
 > once it is hashed into pipeline queue. there is only ever one
 > consumer on each of these queues. so whatever order the data is in
 > in pipeline queue, that is the order it will be processed.
 > 
 > not sure if that answers your question. (i will add some notes in
 > docs)

Thanks a lot.
I think it has a precondition here, you should set the

 > 
 > if you have workload_partitioning disabled:
 > each worker has it's own consumer of all notification queues. they
 > greedily grab, process, and then send to gnocchi (or whatever

 >

 > 
 > once it is hashed into pipeline queue. there is only ever one
 > consumer on each of these queues. so whatever order the data is in
 > in pipeline queue, that is the order it will be processed.

 > docs)

So the tooz will promise that only each queue will only have one consumer?"}]

commit_message:
queues per manager rather than per pipeline

currently we create queue per pipeline which is not necessary. it
creates more memory usage and doesn't necessarily distribute
work more effectively. this hashes data to queues based on
manager but still internally, the data is destined to specific
pipeline based on event_type. this will minimise queue usage while
keeping internal code path the same.

Change-Id: I0ccd51f13457f208fe2ccedb6e680c91e132f78f

commit_message:
Add py35 jobs for refstack-client

Added py35 jobs at check and gate pipelines for refstack-client.
Even when refstack-client code should now support both py27 and py35. Jobs
are added initially as non-voting to give time for refactoring (if needed).

Change-Id: I7eeb56a69943908443276787e55669853264d06c

commit_message:
Change Subnet.dhcp_server to contain multiple IPs

Changed "dhcp_server" field in Subnet object from IPAddressField
to ListOfIPAddressField, because a subnet can have more than one
DHCP server.

The field is renamed to "dhcp_servers".

Currently, this field is not used in Nova [1], which is the only
project importing this library.

[1] http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=dhcp_server&i=nope&files=&repos=nova

Close-Bug: #1720414

Change-Id: I44ed1b17dd30a8a38ecede0a4f82e7f8c1139bcf

subject: Field network.multi_host is now deprecated.
messages:
[{'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2017-09-25 14:39:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-09-25 16:04:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-os-vif-docs-ubuntu-xenial http://docs-draft.openstack.org/51/507151/1/check/gate-os-vif-docs-ubuntu-xenial/18bbea8//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 3m 21s
- gate-os-vif-pep8-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/51/507151/1/check/gate-os-vif-pep8-ubuntu-xenial/79b944a/ : SUCCESS in 3m 53s
- gate-os-vif-python27-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/51/507151/1/check/gate-os-vif-python27-ubuntu-xenial/75c4e2f/ : SUCCESS in 5m 07s
- gate-os-vif-python35 http://logs.openstack.org/51/507151/1/check/gate-os-vif-python35/0dc9a13/ : SUCCESS in 4m 48s
- gate-tempest-dsvm-nova-os-vif-ubuntu-xenial-nv http://logs.openstack.org/51/507151/1/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-nova-os-vif-ubuntu-xenial-nv/fdb61f7/ : SUCCESS in 1h 17m 54s (non-voting)'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2017-09-26 15:59:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2017-09-27 01:06:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

im not sure we can remove this untill we drop nova-networks.

the multi host option is not used when using neutron but os-vif is also used for nova networks where this might ligitimatly be set.'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2017-09-27 14:54:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Sean: this option was deprecated [1] along with nova-networks. By default this value is set to False [2] but is never defined by any config option anymore.

This option is used in nova-networks [3] but os-vif doesn't implement a plugin for nova-networks. Currently is only used in Linux Bridge but only as leftover of a legacy code.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/ocata/config-reference/compute/config-options.html
[2] https://github.com/openstack/os-vif/blob/master/os_vif/objects/network.py#L43
[3] http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=multi_host&i=nope&files=&repos="}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-10-20 20:24:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Sean is right, you can't remove this until nova-network is removed. It's only deprecated generically because nova-network is generically depreated. We hope to remove it in the Rocky release.

os-vif is used for nova-network though, it's part of the vif plug in the libvirt driver. There is no nova-network plugin because that's not a thing - there is no neutron plugin either. The os-vif plugins are specific to vif types, which is different from how they are used wrt nova-network or neutron."}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2017-10-23 09:24:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Nova networks is not using os-vif to create the VIF and network information and there is no plan to do this.

os-vif Network object was created as a replica of Nova Network, keeping some legacy fields on it.

"multi_host" is used only in Nova networks but not in Nova Neutron v2 API [1]. This variable appears in:
- The DB, to store Nova network objects.
- In tests.
- In Nova networks code.

It only appears in [2], and this part of the code, once this patch is merged, won't make any sense.

There is no interdependency between os-vif and Nova networks; that's why we can remove this field from os-vif.

[1] http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=multi_host&i=nope&files=&repos=nova
[2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/network/os_vif_util.py#L233'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-10-24 15:44:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Rodolfo,

nova-compute is using os-vif via the plug_vifs call on the virt driver. That gets it's information from the networking API we're using, which is either neutron or nova-network.

To show this, we have nova-network running in the cells v1 job and I can see os-vif being used here when plugging vifs for the libvirt driver:

http://logs.openstack.org/87/507687/4/gate/gate-tempest-dsvm-cells-ubuntu-xenial/f41d6e0/logs/screen-n-cpu.txt.gz#_Oct_06_13_25_03_613619

So nova-network isn't using this directly, but nova-network is providing the network information about the instance to the compute which is used during vif plugging."}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2017-10-24 15:46:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2017-10-27 08:48:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

Hello Matt:

You are right. nova-networks is using, via libvirt, os-vif to plug/unplug the interface.

This patch should be held until nova-networks is deprecated.'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2017-11-21 08:00:08.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-09-25 14:39:29.000000000', 'message': 'Field network.multi_host is now deprecated.

This field is still in use in Nova. The value is set to "False" during
the initialization. The code related to this field should be removed
from this project.

Change-Id: I120e640f164028a09709b7beef7c2a190385ba42
Closes-Bug: #1719329
'}]
commit_message:
Field network.multi_host is now deprecated.

This field is still in use in Nova. The value is set to "False" during
the initialization. The code related to this field should be removed
from this project.

Change-Id: I120e640f164028a09709b7beef7c2a190385ba42
Closes-Bug: #1719329

commit_message:
Fluent-logging helm chart

This introduces an initial helm chart for fluent logging.
It provides a functional fluent-bit and fluentd deployment to
use in conjunction with elasticsearch and kibana to consume
and aggregate logs from all resource types in a cluster.
It can deliver logs to kafka for external tools to consume.

This PS moved to osh repo
New PS: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/514622/

Specification: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/505491/
Partially implements: blueprint osh-logging-framework

Change-Id: Id23dc37e7b0eae84146e74477ca3e4f53648eb05

commit_message:
tox_install: Make this release script friendly

Make "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for $branch" automation work
by making tox_install.sh take a dummy "-c" argument to
match the expectation of release scripts. [1]

[1] https://github.com/openstack-infra/project-config/blob/5c8fe5a65961aee6fdf292dabe81c71fa297f48d/jenkins/scripts/release-tools/functions#L88

Change-Id: I7ec80a001f6371b6c6be6ca742468a09f64fe30b

commit_message:
zuul: run TripleO jobs with new zuulv3 layout

Configure the layout to execute the scenario001 jobs.
Note that baremetal job will be run on stable/pike and container on
Queens and beyond.

A note has been added in comment explaining more details.

Change-Id: Ibbe35a84a4de14f02d4db0d9d5c7a9b5d01ec8d0

Add TLS for ec2api metadata service

This adds a TLS proxy in front of it so it serves TLS in the
internal network.

bp tls-via-certmonger

(cherry picked from commit df9f68f2061ab5d2a6cb5a43817afd45b2936307)

commit_message:
config-download: use workflow supported in Queens

In Queens, tripleoclient will run a Mistral workflow to execute the
ansible tasks.
See I18815c9920454290d965ef632a29ee13c718cd0d and
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/514701/ for details.

This patch does:

- adding some notes in comments so we cleanup later

Note: a lot of this work will be cleaned up later as we're doing fast
iterations here.

Change-Id: If23e223b4a0387efcc745d02154c6bdd2dee23fc
Implements: ansible-config-download-ci

commit_message:
Pin fluent-plugin-grok-parser to 2.1.4

We are using upstream fluentd, which has bump to 0.14.0. Need use high
version of plugin.

Change-Id: I8bef4e153621be9f2983f05a045e7ce0849483a1
Closes-Bug: #1730664

@Gary: at the time the deprecation was posted, they were users who expressed the desire to keep the tool until a replacement was found. If the situation has changed, I am not sure, but I wouldn't want to remove the tool without assessing again."}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2017-11-21 06:52:36.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Remove neutron debug tool

Commit 1f4c82ce9ea0676c4e813cc34bdb8687f63452e3 marked the code as
deprecated. This is over 18 months ago and no one uses this.

This patch finally removes the code.

Change-Id: Id79a18b6fa977f654d5799b8e91ce3f5f7274728

commit_message:
Support Token Session in Zaqar

Token Session: the basic idea is Zaqar
can support to verify the token with keytone once,
and keep this token valid for a while that means no
need to verity the token again.

This purpose is to enhance the Zaqar's performace,
reduce the time spent on keystone authorization.

Change-Id: I5a5a480a8cdfbb32d3d6267cb7dc441f3bf5a6f4
Implements: blueprint support-token-session-in-zaqar

Remove unnecessary setUp function in testcase

In testcase, setUp will be called automatically. This patch used to
remove setUp functions that do nothing. Besides, it will keep code clean.

TrivialFix: Doc format error in configuration/configuring.rst

License info should be not generated in the output html files,
But previous doc has output the license info in configure doc,
this is to fix that.

commit_message:
Fix: magnum devstack installation with tls-proxy

Fix wrongly used start_tls_proxy function and correctly set api port
when tls-proxy is enabled.

Also remove start_tls_proxy for ec2 which is not required.

Co-Authored-By: yatin <ykarel@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I71b85b5cb018dd790e13aaa1eeefcbb8ac0b3b85
Closes-Bug: #1727613

commit_message:
Tolerate spaces in extra capability values

The intent behind limiting the split of the query string at all appears
to be supporting values with spaces, but it's off-by-one, limiting the
number of splits to 3 (4 parts max) rather than 3 parts max.

This commit also generates new random values for variables id and
computehost_id during each call to _get_fake_host_extra_capabilities()
rather than just once, which is necessary to avoid a failing test due to
duplicate id values.

Closes-Bug: #1732787
Change-Id: I8dc56aa983ca27763a63325810753148cb8d8ecd

commit_message:
Allow deleting leases which failed to start at any time

Leases which failed to start could not be deleted until their end date.
This patch enables deletion of such leases at any time.

Change-Id: I8a4764fdcf4750a0dd89e787ee96d930245e8cf7
Closes-Bug: #1713768
(cherry picked from commit 3c1143085fa38a4e31b06d3c798586caf47dc27c)
