[{'created': '2017-11-14 16:03:34.000000000', 'message': 'Fix display of host details when cpu_info is empty

If a Blazar host was created with an empty cpu_info value, displaying
host details would fail with the error:

    SyntaxError: unexpected EOF while parsing (<string>, line 0)

This is because calling eval() on an empty string raises a SyntaxError.
This patch ensures that if cpu_info is empty, it is set to an empty
dictionary instead.

Change-Id: I38d9f92fd7937de4ec1492d06ddea834b6c423ef
'}]
commit_message:
Fix display of host details when cpu_info is empty

If a Blazar host was created with an empty cpu_info value, displaying
host details would fail with the error:

    SyntaxError: unexpected EOF while parsing (<string>, line 0)

This is because calling eval() on an empty string raises a SyntaxError.
This patch ensures that if cpu_info is empty, it is set to an empty
dictionary instead.

Change-Id: I38d9f92fd7937de4ec1492d06ddea834b6c423ef

commit_message:
Migrate to Zuul v3

Migrate all functional jobs and gate to zuul v3.
We will have to migrate all other legacy jobs too later.
This patch do step 1 in the docs: Move Legacy Jobs to Projects.

Co-Authored-By: Dai Dang Van <daidv@vn.fujitsu.com>
Change-Id: Ie2f41fd211dad4852fadaa05fdda7536f18b38eb
Needed-By: I9fdfe396e6f84b632fae182dade30914865bd3bf
Needed-By: I8e093bd3bb880b6b2c11a20e785c5a562f66159c

commit_message:
Switch to ceph luminous

Tweak override file to install ceph repository from
centos-release-ceph-luminous until Kolla also switch to luminous.

Change-Id: I6abd90807c3a82ebf8213da58f27e51921b75d2e
Partially-Implements: blueprint ceph-luminous

commit_message:
always declare partitioning variables

also, just use partition_coordinator to figure out if we need to handle
stuff as that's what we use everywhere else.

Change-Id: I8724a41408b89f29b600a03fbf1c7febb55fb5e5

commit_message:
Deploy Ceph Luminous and add support for CephMgr service

The upgrade of Ceph to Luminous requires a new daemon, ceph-mgr, to be
deployed with every ceph-mon. This submission adds support for the
deployment of ceph-mgr via ceph-ansible.

Change-Id: I4226233d02b70980c6b53518ae2d511b653ce2de
Depends-On: I3645c6c3f68fcefc93fa8699796ba8892aa946c8
Implements: blueprint ceph-luminous

[{'created': '2017-11-16 05:23:49.000000000', 'message': 'Remove v1 api-ref documents

This commit removes v1 api-ref documents. Because it's very confusing
when people click the "Block Storage API V1 (LEGACY)" links on the
api-ref page[1]. It's just a link to the api-ref object-storage page[1].

[1] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/block-storage/index.html

Change-Id: Ibb19bc1b951298c3f95bca7d123d3b7c9dc6b91c
'}]
commit_message:
Remove v1 api-ref documents

This commit removes v1 api-ref documents. Because it's very confusing
when people click the "Block Storage API V1 (LEGACY)" links on the
api-ref page[1]. It's just a link to the api-ref object-storage page[1].

[1] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/block-storage/index.html

Change-Id: Ibb19bc1b951298c3f95bca7d123d3b7c9dc6b91c

commit_message:
Process test results from a tempest run

Use the process-test-results role from zuul-jobs to generate the
subunit file and html report.

Depends-on: Id6149d4e265ab9f0ab6d8faeffdec651c63dc056
Change-Id: Ib8a43a7d6e4afdca6b2e30d3e7be58b1ac771436

in neutron with I18aebec1e2b5b361d9b96192d4a59e5424c6a80b

commit_message:
use agent api def from neutron-lib

The agent extension's API definition was moved into neutron-lib with
commit Iae4746aa2e3f68a7120696a12a6ae717115dbc31 and will be consumed
in neutron with I18aebec1e2b5b361d9b96192d4a59e5424c6a80b
This patch consumes it by:
- Switching over to lib's implementation for the agent extension.
- Removing the unit test setup that updates the global
RESOURCE_ATTRIBUTE_MAP for the agent. This is done automatically so
is not needed.

Change-Id: Icd545a57835f7c3a79b82cfffd1b6a6ca017fb0b

We discussed an important point with Emilien: services running in a WSGI runner (eg httpd) don't have a command line argument. Right now oslo.config does some magic in find_config_files to get the service configuration in that scenario.

We can't pass the etcd URL, so it would seem that we need a config file for this. oslo_config could register a config key by default for that? It would have the nice benefit that etcd credentials would be in a file instead of the command line.

An alternative is an environment variable, but it's pretty bad."}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2017-04-10 14:03:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thomas: very good point. I think we might want to provide both ways to talk to etcd:

* parameter to give to the process when starting (like we have with --config-file)
* section in the config file (could be used by the WSGI services) with the etcd credentials

I find it acceptable given the fact we don't have much choice to let WSGI apps talking to etcd..."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2017-04-10 15:06:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Thomas: very good point. I think we might want to provide both ways
 > to talk to etcd:
 > 
 > * parameter to give to the process when starting (like we have with
 > --config-file)
 > * section in the config file (could be used by the WSGI services)
 > with the etcd credentials
 > 
 > I find it acceptable given the fact we don't have much choice to
 > let WSGI apps talking to etcd...

Perhaps the config_url option could default to an environment variable to avoid needing to deal with a file."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2017-04-10 22:26:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

There is https://review.openstack.org/#/c/513844/ but it's very early stages."}, {'account_id': 8866, 'date': '2017-11-13 12:06:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

In addition to what Doug said before, I have started the Castellan part of this feature: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/515190/

I believe that we can do at least this basic part (oslo.config and Castellan changes) on this current release and have the entire feature on Rocky (with the Tripleo/ansible change and more tests). What you guys think?'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2017-11-13 14:59:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> In addition to what Doug said before, I have started the Castellan
 > part of this feature: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/515190/
 > 
 > I believe that we can do at least this basic part (oslo.config and
 > Castellan changes) on this current release and have the entire
 > feature on Rocky (with the Tripleo/ansible change and more tests).
 > What you guys think?

I think the main concern is introducing such disruptive changes to a low-level library late in the cycle, when we won't have as much time to test with it.

Let's get the code written and see how it looks. We can evaluate the risk once we see the actual changes."}, {'account_id': 8866, 'date': '2017-11-13 15:02:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Agreed, In the worst case, we will have all the code almost done in Queens and we can finish it early on Rocky.'}, {'account_id': 8866, 'date': '2017-11-13 15:02:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 22604, 'date': '2017-11-13 20:43:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

commit_message:
Pluggable drivers for oslo.config

Provide an interface to implement external config readers.

Change-Id: I9833f16088289147f38ea0dd03b2ba56106aa9b5
Co-Authorized-By: Emilien Macchi <emilien@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add ansible and pyton-shade to the base image

Ansible and shade will be used to run some of the provisioning
operations as part of the kubernetes and ansible role based deployment
of the services. Having it in the base images makes it possible to use
any of the service images to run ansible commands, just like we do with
puppet.

Change-Id: I76efb92e27955b6e9054d4e7dcfda5ba1d8b2d2f

messages: [{'account_id': 24978, 'date': '2017-11-01 07:50:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 24209, 'date': '2017-11-08 08:23:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2017-11-09 23:54:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 21430, 'date': '2017-11-12 12:54:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 10850, 'date': '2017-11-20 23:53:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-01 07:50:15.000000000', 'message': 'Fix KeyError exception in ChanceScheduler.schedule

The return value of function "get_agent_hosting_loadbalancer" is either
None or a dict. Most of the time, it looks good because it usually
returns None. But when multi neutron-server rescheduled the same
loadbalancer from a dead agent almost simultaneously, it might return a
dict, which would cause KeyError since the dict format is such like
{'agent': {'id': xxx, ...}}.

Change-Id: Iac0f99590146ef870a979a6b4ac28b69e9e186e4
Closes-Bug: #1668513
(cherry picked from commit ad7a78197665afc98a1ae4dc5bfabf2019e93241)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix KeyError exception in ChanceScheduler.schedule

The return value of function "get_agent_hosting_loadbalancer" is either
None or a dict. Most of the time, it looks good because it usually
returns None. But when multi neutron-server rescheduled the same
loadbalancer from a dead agent almost simultaneously, it might return a
dict, which would cause KeyError since the dict format is such like
{'agent': {'id': xxx, ...}}.

Change-Id: Iac0f99590146ef870a979a6b4ac28b69e9e186e4
Closes-Bug: #1668513
(cherry picked from commit ad7a78197665afc98a1ae4dc5bfabf2019e93241)

the octavia.conf. This patch corrects that behavior so the "parallel" engine
can be used.

Change-Id: I4e9a21f1c58cbf65f4247fe3e2255dc614080bc7

commit_message:
Fix TaskFlow loader to honor engine configuration

The TaskFlow flow loader was not honoring the TaskFlow engine configured in
the octavia.conf. This patch corrects that behavior so the "parallel" engine
can be used.

Change-Id: I4e9a21f1c58cbf65f4247fe3e2255dc614080bc7

commit_message:
Include project_id and user_id in AllocationList.get_all_by_consumer_id

To support including project_id and user_id in the output of GET
/allocations/{consumer_uuid} adjust the
_get_allocations_by_consumer_uuid query to join the necessary tables to
get project_id and user_id information.

Note that this is done as outer joins because in order to support older
(but not much older) microversions we need to allow those fields to be
null.

_get_allocations_by_provider_id is not extended in the same way as we
do not yet have any immediate need for the information in GET
/resource_providers/{uuid}/allocations.

Change-Id: I59175fa51e9553f41c73a6bcd1a77a134e0b19e3
Partially-Implements: bp symmetric-allocations

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-12 12:07:24.000000000', 'message': "Fix tempest scenario tests waiters

Cleanups for resources such as listeners, pools and health monitors are
currently using a waiter named _wait_for_load_balancer_status to get an
indication that the cleanup process ended successfully.

Because of the way that waiter is currently used in those cleanups,
it's basically just checking that the load balancer state is:
provisioning_status='ACTIVE'
operating_status='ONLINE'

This is not a good measure for the success of a cleanup for the
aforementioned resources since the deletion process of those simply has
no effect on either loadbalancer provisioning_status or
operating_status. Thus, this is not a good indicator.

This creates issues on high load test deployments.
For example: test_listener_basic is a scenario that deletes a listener
and verifies the absence of the load balancing functionality via
_check_load_balancing_after_deleting_resources.
In case the listener deletion is still undergoing (and currently it
does not have a good indication for that), the load balancer will
accept the traffic and fail the test.

The suggestion solution here is not to use _wait_for_load_balancer_status
as an indicator, but rather add waiters to check specifically if a given
resource got deleted or not.

Change-Id: Ib2e4c60e2db28f1345665c2f5859e8f5fde75bc0
(cherry picked from commit e7f14a6a5ca2472960d7a015b97b4cab580d3f53)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix tempest scenario tests waiters

Cleanups for resources such as listeners, pools and health monitors are
currently using a waiter named _wait_for_load_balancer_status to get an
indication that the cleanup process ended successfully.

Because of the way that waiter is currently used in those cleanups,
it's basically just checking that the load balancer state is:
provisioning_status='ACTIVE'
operating_status='ONLINE'

This is not a good measure for the success of a cleanup for the
aforementioned resources since the deletion process of those simply has
no effect on either loadbalancer provisioning_status or
operating_status. Thus, this is not a good indicator.

This creates issues on high load test deployments.
For example: test_listener_basic is a scenario that deletes a listener
and verifies the absence of the load balancing functionality via
_check_load_balancing_after_deleting_resources.
In case the listener deletion is still undergoing (and currently it
does not have a good indication for that), the load balancer will
accept the traffic and fail the test.

The suggestion solution here is not to use _wait_for_load_balancer_status
as an indicator, but rather add waiters to check specifically if a given
resource got deleted or not.

Change-Id: Ib2e4c60e2db28f1345665c2f5859e8f5fde75bc0
(cherry picked from commit e7f14a6a5ca2472960d7a015b97b4cab580d3f53)

commit_message:
Enable python hash randomization for tests

This should be enabled for all tests to ensure we don't introduce
bugs related to code relying on ordering of unordered types.

Change-Id: I11bcac3c1a5b6999bd82c2c430880cdfb2026593

commit_message:
Remove TLS-specific docker environment

This environment was made for testing, and was only meant to exist while
TLS everywhere got service parity. This is now the case (and has been
since pike was released) so we can safely remove this file.

Change-Id: Ib97cab101ee727ae8d784ecb7847dabdbac3ff17

Import the new jobs from tripleo-ci, with parity from what we had before
with legacy jobs:
- buildimage jobs
- ovb-ha

commit_message:
pluggable notification agent

event, meter (and any other custom pipeline) can be enabled/disabled
by setting `pipelines` option under [notification] agent

Change-Id: Ia21256d0308457d077836e27b45d2acb8bb697e4
Closes-Bug: #1720021

commit_message:
Fix the deprecated syntax in 01-rewrite.conf

Before pike, kolla use upstream fluentd repo. and it is now bump to
v0.14. So need update the rewite syntax.

Change-Id: I0b131c2f65652cf3c61b33d8162097b047603923
Closes-Bug: #1730664
(cherry picked from commit 419a2fc9fd206447f37fbcf62da8e15ab96f8530)

commit_message:
Add option for HAProxy (non-HA) container to log to stdout/stderr

This adds the option to get the HAProxy container to log to stdout.
The option is disabled by default. If enabled, It also adds a sidecar
container that reads from syslog and outputs what it gets to stdout.

bp logging-stdout-rsyslog

Change-Id: Ica819713aa50352ba04a748c463534d982e00538

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-13 14:07:20.000000000', 'message': 'Add rsyslog-sidecar resource and configuration

This introduces a "sidecar" container, which is meant to be used
besides other containers (or as part of the pod). It merely uses
rsyslog to listen on a specific UNIX socket and outputs what it
gets to stdout.

This adds the service to each relevant role and introduces a
composable service which merely configures the container. Subsequently
it'll be used as part of other templates.

Note that it is only enabled if "stdout logging" is enabled.

bp logging-stdout-rsyslog
Depends-On: I4864ddca223becd0a17f902729cf2e566df5e521

Change-Id: I2c54acaaa820961c936f1fbe304f42162f720496

commit_message:
Add rsyslog-sidecar resource and configuration

This introduces a "sidecar" container, which is meant to be used
besides other containers (or as part of the pod). It merely uses
rsyslog to listen on a specific UNIX socket and outputs what it
gets to stdout.

This adds the service to each relevant role and introduces a
composable service which merely configures the container. Subsequently
it'll be used as part of other templates.

Note that it is only enabled if "stdout logging" is enabled.

bp logging-stdout-rsyslog
Depends-On: I4864ddca223becd0a17f902729cf2e566df5e521

Change-Id: I2c54acaaa820961c936f1fbe304f42162f720496

commit_message:
Fix the undercloud-containers job

The undercloud installer (when using --heat-native) can configure
its own docker settings.

Also, use yum install to add required packages until we can get these
installed via RDO.

Ensure the /etc/hosts file is cleaned out for the undercloud deployment

Co-Authored-By: Wes Hayutin <weshayutin@gmail.com>

Depends-On: I2d569eef136254dc81bdee93a7869fd361a8400d
Change-Id: I583128ef8fb986a08ea372344ed072e506b97d89

subject: Able to change monitor address and port of member
messages:
[{'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2017-11-14 15:18:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2017-11-17 18:03:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Can we rename the "Edit weight" button to be "Edit member"?
This button on both the pool detail page and the member detail page is mis-leading as you can now edit the monitor port and address.
As a bonus, it would be nice to make this button a drop down with the option to delete on the member details page. That would make it consistent with the other object edit buttons.'}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2017-11-19 07:50:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2017-11-19 07:52:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

Would like to make the drop down change separately as another bug fix, as it requires too much changes in the controllers.

Made it multi line, hopefully the functionality works.'}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2017-11-19 08:10:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2017-11-19 08:14:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2017-11-19 10:32:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2017-11-19 10:36:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2017-11-19 10:41:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 6579, 'date': '2017-11-19 11:10:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Is this ready for review?'}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2017-11-19 11:28:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Yes, ready now, just running for dinner, so get some change rushed out.'}, {'account_id': 6579, 'date': '2017-11-19 14:24:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

I get both Monitor Address and Monitor Port as None.
When I click 'Edit' and enter some values that get accepted I still need to refresh the member details page to see the new data.
Can auto-refresh so the user will see the updated values right away?

Load Balancers Load Balancer 1 Listener 1 Pool 1 d038395a-321b-4642-b8b7-c498bbdb1177
Address
33.33.33.9
Admin State Up
Yes
Member ID
d038395a-321b-4642-b8b7-c498bbdb1177
Operating Status
Error
Project ID
0040f4edde024498a20f6c48d9fdae43
Protocol Port
80
Provisioning Status
Active
Subnet ID
bef61063-db6f-43d3-bea4-0ac82655c0cd
Weight
1
Monitor Address
None
Monitor Port
None
Created At
2017-11-19T14:17:14
Updated At
2017-11-19T14:17:16"}, {'account_id': 6579, 'date': '2017-11-19 14:24:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2017-11-20 01:08:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

That’s another old bug needs to be solved, even without this change it won’t do auto refresh.'}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2017-11-20 03:24:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Let's do things one by one.
Also the auto refresh I would expect to be a global change that would affect all the resources and routes."}, {'account_id': 6579, 'date': '2017-11-20 13:52:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2

> Let's do things one by one.
 > Also the auto refresh I would expect to be a global change that
 > would affect all the resources and routes.

Fair enough. if that issue exists outside of that exact form we don't need to look at it in the scope of this patch.

Can you please submit a bug against the refresh issue (in case there is no such bug)?"}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2017-11-20 14:09:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Thanks, man! I think Michael has submitted several bugs regarding this.
Still have two or more UI bug fixes to do ahead.
Then I'll try to fix that missing after actions, needs refresh after actions issue."}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2017-11-20 14:50:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

@johnsom, I added the delete action for member in 
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/521551/
The next bug to go is:
https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/1713844

Regarding https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/1713854
For the listeners action list, it is intended to do like this:
if no pool is created yet, it has create pool and delete actions also. if there is a default pool, a listener can not be deleted.
So it hides the delete and create pool button.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2017-11-21 00:55:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

This looks great, thanks!'}]

(3 comments)

In my environment everything seems to be working except cinder because I am getting the effective permissions as assigned by the ACL of "---" [1] and the cinder logs indicate that sit is not able to initialize the RBD driver [2]. 

To workaround it after the deployment I simply connect to the controller node and run the same setfacl on the file and getfacl no longer returns the effective permissions [3] and the cinder user is able to read the key. 

So why does the same setfacl command not produce the desired effective permissions the first time? I'm researching that. 

[1] 
[root@overcloud-controller-0 ~]# getfacl /etc/ceph/ceph.client.openstack.keyring
getfacl: Removing leading '/' from absolute path names
# file: etc/ceph/ceph.client.openstack.keyring
# owner: root
# group: root
user::rw-
user:cinder:r--			#effective:---
group::---
mask::---
other::---

[root@overcloud-controller-0 ~]#

[2]
2017-10-18 10:16:29.149 83616 ERROR cinder.service [-] Manager for service cinder-volume hostgroup@tripleo_ceph is reporting problems, not sending heartbeat. Service will appear "down".
2017-10-18 10:16:32.088 83616 WARNING cinder.volume.manager [req-95a837f4-496e-4e4a-9961-dbd938048433 - - - - -] Update driver status failed: (config name tripleo_ceph) is uninitialized.

[3] 
[root@overcloud-controller-0 cinder]# setfacl -m cinder:r /etc/ceph/ceph.client.openstack.keyring
[root@overcloud-controller-0 cinder]# getfacl !$
getfacl /etc/ceph/ceph.client.openstack.keyring
getfacl: Removing leading '/' from absolute path names
# file: etc/ceph/ceph.client.openstack.keyring
# owner: root
# group: root
user::rw-
user:cinder:r--
group::---
mask::r--
other::---

[root@overcloud-controller-0 cinder]#'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2017-10-20 18:02:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2017-10-20 20:05:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

Earlier I wrote:
 > In my environment everything seems to be working except cinder
 > because I am getting the effective permissions as assigned by the
 > ACL of "---" ...
 > So why does the same setfacl command not produce the desired
 > effective permissions the first time? I'm researching that.
 
I think this is because the chmod command is run after the ACL command by ceph-ansible:  

https://github.com/ceph/ceph-ansible/blob/7d429410901601a0b29d2be079aaf2bcc7c2bb94/roles/ceph-client/tasks/create_users_keys.yml#L34-L54

This same THT worked for me in the past because that was before the chmod option was added to ceph-ansible: 

https://github.com/ceph/ceph-ansible/commits/7d429410901601a0b29d2be079aaf2bcc7c2bb94/roles/ceph-client/tasks/create_users_keys.yml 

The fix will be to use the ACL mask:

When an application changes any of the owner, group, or other class permissions (e.g., via the chmod command), the corresponding ACL entry changes as well. Likewise, when an application changes the permissions of an ACL entry that maps to one of the user classes, the permissions of the class change. 
...
With extended ACLs, this is implemented by masking permissions (hence the name of the mask entry): permissions in entries that are a member of the group class which are also present in the mask entry are effective. Permissions that are absent in the mask entry are masked and thus do not take effect.

As per: https://www.usenix.org/legacy/events/usenix03/tech/freenix03/full_papers/gruenbacher/gruenbacher_html/main.html'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2017-10-20 21:03:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13:

There is no setfacl command I can run, for which the chmod alone cannot change the results. I can reproduce the problem with: 

 setfacl -m cinder:r /etc/ceph/ceph.client.openstack.keyring
 chmod 600 ceph.client.openstack.keyring

When the keys are created they have a restrictive set of permissions by default, so the extra chmod 600 is not necessary and causing the problem. So what I want is to only run only the setfacl, not the chmod.

The bug is that ceph-ansible always assumes that the keys map will always contain a mode key (e.g. that keys{'mode': $foo} always exists).

So I will look into a change to ceph-ansible next."}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2017-10-23 13:04:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13:

I wrote: 
 > When the keys are created they have a restrictive set of
 > permissions by default, so the extra chmod 600 is not necessary and
 > causing the problem. So what I want is to only run only the
 > setfacl, not the chmod.
 > 
 > The bug is that ceph-ansible always assumes that the keys map will
 > always contain a mode key (e.g. that keys{'mode': $foo} always
 > exists).
 > 
 > So I will look into a change to ceph-ansible next.

https://github.com/ceph/ceph-ansible/issues/2092"}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2017-10-25 23:06:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2017-10-25 23:08:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2017-10-25 23:10:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 16: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2017-10-25 23:14:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

The combination of this change and the following ceph-ansible change: 

 https://github.com/ceph/ceph-ansible/pull/2110

will set the ACL and permissions of the openstack keyring securely and as required by Cinder when it does not run as a containerized service. 

This change now depends on Ic33cb930a7e81e58527e3771e3401c844137cf1d which will test the ceph-ansible change above, when it becomes available, but before the rest of TripleO CI uses it. 

Waiting for ceph-ansible PR above and then CI results when run with the new PR'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2017-10-26 10:02:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2017-10-26 11:55:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16: Workflow-1

scenario001-multinode-oooq-container failed as expected because the ceph-ansible [1] change hasn't yet merged. The reason it failed is because cinder couldn't communicate with ceph [2] because the keyring file's permission is too restrictive but won't be with these THT parameters after we have the pending ceph-ansible change [1]. 

We'll just have to be sure not to merge this until the CA change [1] is merged first. 


[1] https://github.com/fultonj/ceph-ansible/commit/ae156e9f34ed9083382bedf53d8f451360ce978a

[2] http://logs.openstack.org/75/508975/16/check/legacy-tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario001-multinode-oooq-container/57ced1a/logs/subnode-2/var/log/cinder/volume.log.txt.gz#_2017-10-26_01_01_08_551"}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2017-10-26 15:03:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

commit_message:
Set file mode permission for Ceph keyrings in containers

Pass mode parameter to ceph-ansible for Ceph keyrings on container
host. Pass mode and ownership parameter to each Ceph client container
using kolla_config. ACLs are set for Cinder if it is not running in
containers.

Change-Id: I11618b3fd696739ad9b86618a1f3f96570c61a30
Partial-Bug: #1720787

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-02 18:44:26.000000000', 'message': "Prevent pyroute2.IPDB threads leaking

pyroute2.IPDB is an interesting entity. It's much more than a simple
interface to `ip` command, as it is more similar to a database process.
When created IPDB object spawns a thread that will be responsible for
updating the object with changes to the underlying OS. Thread stays up
until the user will call `release()` method.

Turns out code in kuryr_kubernetes.cni.binding wasn't taking that into
account and was slowly leaking threads (and possibly processes). This
became apparent when running Kuryr with CNI daemon enabled.

This commit fixes the problem by switching all IPDB usages to context
managers, so `release()` method is called automatically.  Also the IPDB
objects cache is removed as already released IPDB objects cannot be
reused.

Change-Id: I82afda3f217dac56228677bb66703c3d80e5d751
Closes-Bug: 1728996
"}, {'created': '2017-11-03 10:06:59.000000000', 'message': "Prevent pyroute2.IPDB threads leaking

When created IPDB object spawns a thread that will be responsible for
updating the object with changes to the underlying OS. Thread stays up
until the user will call `release()` method.

Turns out code in kuryr_kubernetes.cni.binding wasn't taking that into
account and was slowly leaking threads (and possibly processes). This
became apparent when running Kuryr with CNI daemon enabled.

This commit fixes the problem by switching all IPDB usages to context
managers, so `release()` method is called automatically.  Also the IPDB
objects cache is removed as already released IPDB objects cannot be
reused.

Change-Id: I82afda3f217dac56228677bb66703c3d80e5d751
Closes-Bug: 1728996
"}, {'created': '2017-11-07 22:13:13.000000000', 'message': "Prevent pyroute2.IPDB threads leaking

until the user will call `release()` method.

Turns out code in kuryr_kubernetes.cni.binding wasn't taking that into
account and was slowly leaking threads (and possibly processes). This
became apparent when running Kuryr with CNI daemon enabled.

This commit fixes the problem by switching all IPDB usages to context
managers, so `release()` method is called automatically.  Also the IPDB
objects cache is removed as already released IPDB objects cannot be
reused.

Change-Id: I82afda3f217dac56228677bb66703c3d80e5d751
Closes-Bug: 1728996
"}, {'created': '2017-11-08 19:19:46.000000000', 'message': "Prevent pyroute2.IPDB threads leaking

pyroute2.IPDB is an interesting entity. It's much more than a simple
interface to `ip` command, as it is more similar to a database process.
When created IPDB object spawns a thread that will be responsible for
updating the object with changes to the underlying OS. Thread stays up
until the user will call `release()` method.

Turns out code in kuryr_kubernetes.cni.binding wasn't taking that into
account and was slowly leaking threads (and possibly processes). This
became apparent when running Kuryr with CNI daemon enabled.

This commit fixes the problem by switching all IPDB usages to context
managers, so `release()` method is called automatically.  Also the IPDB
objects cache is removed as already released IPDB objects cannot be
reused. kuryr_kubernetes.cni.binding modules were missing unit tests,
this commit adds them as well.

"}, {'created': '2017-11-09 15:15:52.000000000', 'message': "Prevent pyroute2.IPDB threads leaking

pyroute2.IPDB is an interesting entity. It's much more than a simple
interface to `ip` command, as it is more similar to a database process.
When created IPDB object spawns a thread that will be responsible for
updating the object with changes to the underlying OS. Thread stays up
until the user will call `release()` method.

Turns out code in kuryr_kubernetes.cni.binding wasn't taking that into
account and was slowly leaking threads (and possibly processes). This
became apparent when running Kuryr with CNI daemon enabled.

This commit fixes the problem by switching all IPDB usages to context
managers, so `release()` method is called automatically.  Also the IPDB
objects cache is removed as already released IPDB objects cannot be
reused. kuryr_kubernetes.cni.binding modules were missing unit tests,
this commit adds them as well.

Change-Id: I82afda3f217dac56228677bb66703c3d80e5d751

commit_message:
Prevent pyroute2.IPDB threads leaking

pyroute2.IPDB is an interesting entity. It's much more than a simple
interface to `ip` command, as it is more similar to a database process.
When created IPDB object spawns a thread that will be responsible for
updating the object with changes to the underlying OS. Thread stays up
until the user will call `release()` method.

Turns out code in kuryr_kubernetes.cni.binding wasn't taking that into
account and was slowly leaking threads (and possibly processes). This
became apparent when running Kuryr with CNI daemon enabled.

This commit fixes the problem by switching all IPDB usages to context
managers, so `release()` method is called automatically.  Also the IPDB
objects cache is removed as already released IPDB objects cannot be
reused. kuryr_kubernetes.cni.binding modules were missing unit tests,
this commit adds them as well.

Change-Id: I82afda3f217dac56228677bb66703c3d80e5d751
Closes-Bug: 1728996

commit_message:
Fixed generated temp file problem for RBD backend

Generated file doesn't have EOF char and it is problematic to read
by rados libraries.
New line char fix the problem.

Closes-bug: #1684077

Change-Id: I4f2eecafbe13e65cdcc24e46ae664760fa3ec306
(cherry picked from commit 72ce87338c183f691999e0a8af564c23636e91f3)

commit_message:
Set host name explicitly for telemetry

Without this there could be a mismatch with other services like
nova and neutron and ceilometer wont find nova instances.

Closes-bug: #1721054

Depends-On: I421a61dc31bd10fec0a10bf7e867001cf4dd3f02

Change-Id: I92f6d351931f1ea598d6a382704e8f986129be42
(cherry picked from commit efa7f8f515d1e35b32960c9564618cecb63020a6)

commit_message:
Add missing domain parameter to _get_group_roles

Adds missing 'domain' parameter to function which
was causing errors when using keystone federation.

Change-Id: Icfc06feae806a9faf8f4d12bf2281dd6c9772989
Closes-Bug: 1733108
Signed-off-by: Michael Rice <michael@michaelrice.org>

commit_message:
Ingress: Remove resolv.conf workaround

This PS removes the resolv.conf workaround as it has not been
required for some time, now that we can set the Pod DNS policy
to "ClusterFirstWithHostNet".

Change-Id: Ibdef3357e69f1f06f3d0c0b398466d1b9d24b8ca

im not seeing openstacksdk as a requirement for shade, so i dont quite follow how its a circular dep'}, {'account_id': 8246, 'date': '2017-11-20 02:13:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2017-11-20 23:22:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Workflow+1

Sam - it will be, but is not today. The main issue is what you say though - shade doesn't depend on sdk, so the ansible functional tests currently don't actually test anything."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-16 14:29:59.000000000', 'message': "Remove ansible functional tests for now

These aren't actually testing openstacksdk in any way at the moment,
and having them is making us have a test-requirements depend on shade
which will make adding openstacksdk as a shade requirement a circular
dependency.

Remove them for now. To re-add them, we want to:

- add openstacksdk as a shade requirement
- update ansible to import openstack instead of import shade

Once that's done, we can add the tests back, but without adding shade as
an sdk test-requirement. That way we can have shade test that the
ansible modules work if someone installs shade and doesn't explicitly
install sdk, and we can have sdk test that the modules work if someone
installs sdk and not shade.

Change-Id: Icb26f9c066bad6c2c045ac949ac1864e26b5b837
"}, {'created': '2017-11-16 22:12:07.000000000', 'message': "Remove ansible functional tests for now

Once that's done, we can add the tests back, but without adding shade as

commit_message:
Remove ansible functional tests for now

These aren't actually testing openstacksdk in any way at the moment,
and having them is making us have a test-requirements depend on shade
which will make adding openstacksdk as a shade requirement a circular
dependency.

Remove them for now. To re-add them, we want to:

- add openstacksdk as a shade requirement
- update ansible to import openstack instead of import shade

Once that's done, we can add the tests back, but without adding shade as
an sdk test-requirement. That way we can have shade test that the
ansible modules work if someone installs shade and doesn't explicitly
install sdk, and we can have sdk test that the modules work if someone
installs sdk and not shade.

Change-Id: Icb26f9c066bad6c2c045ac949ac1864e26b5b837

subject: Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes
messages: [{'account_id': 25571, 'date': '2017-11-17 10:07:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8246, 'date': '2017-11-20 02:14:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2017-11-20 23:21:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-17 10:07:50.000000000', 'message': "Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html

Change-Id: Id0925ef2efce76024dbf1d519e92be3fdcff940b
"}]
commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html

Change-Id: Id0925ef2efce76024dbf1d519e92be3fdcff940b

subject: Stop indexing libvirt logs
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1, 'name': 'James E. Blair', 'email': 'jim@acmegating.com', 'username': 'corvus'}, {'_account_id': 2, 'name': 'Monty Taylor', 'email': 'mordred@inaugust.com', 'username': 'mordred'}, {'_account_id': 4146, 'name': 'Clark Boylan', 'email': 'cboylan@sapwetik.org', 'username': 'cboylan'}, {'_account_id': 5263, 'name': 'Jeremy Stanley', 'display_name': 'fungi', 'email': 'fungi@yuggoth.org', 'username': 'fungi', 'status': 'missing, presumed fed'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages: [{'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2017-11-20 23:28:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-11-20 23:30:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1\n\nYup, I didn't even realize we were indexing these, and we don't use them in any existing elastic-recheck queries. If anything, I've needed the qemu guest logs indexed more than the actual libvirtd logs."}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2017-11-20 23:52:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2017-11-20 23:52:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2017-11-20 23:55:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2017-11-20 23:55:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-20 23:28:55.000000000', 'message': "Stop indexing libvirt logs

The libvirt log files can be quite large depending on the job run (into
the million line range). This means they take significant amounts of
time to index which backs up all the indexing. Lets remove these files
for now (mriedem, nova ptl, has said this won't be a great loss for
them) and if someone needs them indexed again they can help sort out how
to do it more quickly.

Change-Id: I6b567eaf8a59634bc2486423bd87553605bb9657
"}]
commit_message:
Stop indexing libvirt logs

The libvirt log files can be quite large depending on the job run (into
the million line range). This means they take significant amounts of
time to index which backs up all the indexing. Lets remove these files
for now (mriedem, nova ptl, has said this won't be a great loss for
them) and if someone needs them indexed again they can help sort out how
to do it more quickly.

Change-Id: I6b567eaf8a59634bc2486423bd87553605bb9657

commit_message:
KubeADM: Move shell commands to use bash and set env vars

This PS moves the shell module invocations to use bash and set the
required env vars explicity. This can seolve some issues on ubuntu
workstation hosts which uses dash for shell commands by default.

Change-Id: Ieb440e421d9d95676719d66fb4c787f88a9d8a2b

commit_message:
Use openstack commands for postci

Switch the nova and heat commands to the openstackclient equivalients.
Due to the way that the openstack commands run, it is more efficient to
pipe in a set of commands than run them individually.

Change-Id: I982b618fd39e3f148bfa4d6e784306fa01c4b30d

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-16 10:16:16.000000000', 'message': 'Include swift base class in the proxy class

This was missing, and therefore the Swif hashes were not properly set in
swift.conf if only the proxy manifest was applied (for example when
deploying separate storage nodes).

Related-Bug: 1732663
Change-Id: I11c044bbc8b9f56f95ace9320cc77303d9a7543e
'}]
commit_message:
Include swift base class in the proxy class

This was missing, and therefore the Swif hashes were not properly set in
swift.conf if only the proxy manifest was applied (for example when
deploying separate storage nodes).

Related-Bug: 1732663
Change-Id: I11c044bbc8b9f56f95ace9320cc77303d9a7543e

subject: Connection doc add arguments
messages:
[{'account_id': 17109, 'date': '2017-08-29 07:40:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-08-29 08:27:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-python-openstacksdk-docs-ubuntu-xenial http://docs-draft.openstack.org/05/498705/1/check/gate-python-openstacksdk-docs-ubuntu-xenial/0195059//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 4m 37s
- gate-python-openstacksdk-pep8-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/05/498705/1/check/gate-python-openstacksdk-pep8-ubuntu-xenial/13c0a82/ : SUCCESS in 4m 25s
- gate-python-openstacksdk-python27-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/05/498705/1/check/gate-python-openstacksdk-python27-ubuntu-xenial/8341de3/ : SUCCESS in 3m 07s
- gate-python-openstacksdk-python35 http://logs.openstack.org/05/498705/1/check/gate-python-openstacksdk-python35/146f56a/ : SUCCESS in 3m 07s
- gate-python-openstacksdk-pypy http://logs.openstack.org/05/498705/1/check/gate-python-openstacksdk-pypy/8e6098f/ : SUCCESS in 3m 38s (non-voting)
- gate-sdk-dsvm-functional-ubuntu-xenial-nv http://logs.openstack.org/05/498705/1/check/gate-sdk-dsvm-functional-ubuntu-xenial-nv/1411a3e/ : SUCCESS in 32m 30s (non-voting)
- gate-sdk-dsvm-load-balancer-functional-ubuntu-xenial-nv http://logs.openstack.org/05/498705/1/check/gate-sdk-dsvm-load-balancer-functional-ubuntu-xenial-nv/8a0d5dc/ : SUCCESS in 46m 38s (non-voting)'}, {'account_id': 8257, 'date': '2017-08-29 12:44:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Is this actually correct? As specified on the issue, I was using user_domain_id and project_domain_id and that worked. Those are arguments of keystoneauth, so we should perhaps just link to what arguments are needed by KSA in order to have this work, rather than maintain something that we think works for everyone.'}, {'account_id': 8246, 'date': '2017-11-20 02:22:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

This seems valid to me.
For keystone authn, you are supposed to provide user name together with user_domain_name or user_domain_id, or else user name cannot be uniquely identified. Because domain names and domain ids are all globally unique, providing either of them would suffice.

The same applies to project_name.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2017-11-20 19:57:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

I agree in general with Brian - this is actually HIGHLY keystone auth plugin dependent and I think we should not attempt to document all the different ways in which auth parameters can exist. However, since this is a simple example in a doc string, we should go ahead and include user_domain_name and project_domain_name so that the example is at least close.'}]

commit_message:
Add support to generate a sample undercloud.conf

This is needed to kick off undercloud install with
--use-heat option. This includes new config options
to configure containerized undercloud along with
existing instack options.

Change-Id: Ibebaf068018a790afdb599e4e6fbc79d3b2a57dc
Partially-implements: blueprint heat-undercloud

commit_message:
Zuul: add file extension to playbook path

Zuul now supports including the file extension on the playbook path
and omitting the extension is now deprecrated.  Update references
to include the extension.

Change-Id: I4bff5f12742364f7cc92e17869a047fd2185dda4

commit_message:
Enable ntp iburst

By default the upstream puppetlab module does not enable this option for
Red Hat based systems. Since some of the services we deploy are
sensitive to clock skew, let's switch ibrust on to improve
syncronization.

Change-Id: I918e1e9bbdc35235a552555458a0f4118b70e988
Closes-Bug: #1731883
(cherry picked from commit 3f13662c8033b5af5e1c35107d9e37df96903eaa)
(cherry picked from commit 077fd545b03ebcd2ddf8f3b5a702926b2c6f26db)

commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Fix two releasenotes that used broken RST, `X' is invalid, use instead
``X``. The release notes build failed due to the broken RST.

Change-Id: I5f526f39bdc9bb76266b5a86a4b96854db21d0de

commit_message:
Temporarily make opensuse jobs non-voting

As we're getting failures for opensuse jobs due to broken
mirrors so we're forced to switch all opensuse tests to
non-voting until the infra mirrors are fixed.

Change-Id: I50b50f3d098a83010d6411f8ea09fbce9ae7f638

commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

commit_message:
Format SwiftRawDisks before attempting to mount

Current play only attempts to mount the disk and does not actually
format it for Swift usage.

Change-Id: I8e47b977407491faa71bb196211eeccf21357c54
(cherry picked from commit 93adbba5f5db99274dec924a6d9e36a4220dbf9d)

subject: Use staging directory for prepare-docs-for-afs
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-09-22 17:29:35.000000000', 'message': 'Use staging directory for prepare-docs-for-afs

Rather then doing out work inside the build/html folder, use a staging
folder. This will prevent our fetch-sphinx-output role from copying
the contents of build/html until we are actually ready for the docs to
publish.

This fixes an issue where feature branch docs should not be published,
but actually are because build/html always contains data.

Change-Id: I9fbd5c4cfa984ba7d693c46faf48751d2fbdf5f5
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2017-09-22 18:08:54.000000000', 'message': 'Use staging directory for prepare-docs-for-afs

Rather then doing out work inside the build/html folder, use a staging
folder. This will prevent our fetch-sphinx-output role from copying
the contents of build/html until we are actually ready for the docs to
publish.

This fixes an issue where feature branch docs should not be published,
but actually are because build/html always contains data.

Change-Id: I9fbd5c4cfa984ba7d693c46faf48751d2fbdf5f5

commit_message:
Use staging directory for prepare-docs-for-afs

Rather then doing out work inside the build/html folder, use a staging
folder. This will prevent our fetch-sphinx-output role from copying
the contents of build/html until we are actually ready for the docs to
publish.

This fixes an issue where feature branch docs should not be published,
but actually are because build/html always contains data.

Change-Id: I9fbd5c4cfa984ba7d693c46faf48751d2fbdf5f5
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Complete move of baremetal machine tests

Migrating tests to wrap up machine actions.

Ports will be migrated separately as there
will also need to be portgroups, which could
be wrapped into the same file/class depending
on how that ends up being implemented.

Change-Id: I239bbc134f42a47e8df75531dbd50916a97a6068

commit_message:
Zuul: add file extension to playbook path

Zuul now supports including the file extension on the playbook path
and omitting the extension is now deprecrated.  Update references
to include the extension.

Change-Id: I73f7288f383884c9a157227837464365fb543891

MongoDB: Fix race with setting up auth for DB

This PS moves the post-start script contents into the main launch
script to resolve a race condition and also make debugging issues
simpler.

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-17 19:26:04.000000000', 'message': 'zuul: run TripleO jobs with new zuulv3 layout

Configure the layout to execute the scenario002 jobs.
Note that baremetal job will be run on stable/pike and container on
Queens and beyond.

A note has been added in comment explaining more details.

Change-Id: I36906ea111a4dc7b5ee3224ee439c6be56e6a710
'}]
commit_message:
zuul: run TripleO jobs with new zuulv3 layout

Configure the layout to execute the scenario002 jobs.
Note that baremetal job will be run on stable/pike and container on
Queens and beyond.

A note has been added in comment explaining more details.

Change-Id: I36906ea111a4dc7b5ee3224ee439c6be56e6a710

Add fluent-based logging mechanism description

This PS adds logging requirements and EFK (Elasticsearch,
Fluent-bit & Fluentd, Kibana) based logging mechanism description.

While this is better than what we have now, we should probably utilize status codes more explicitly in IPA/Ironic client communication. For instance, today, if you POST a command to the agent, and the agent has a command in progress, it throws a 500 error instead of something more specific (503? 423?) and then we could put proper retry logic here.

For this case, I'd suggest filing a bug and/or adding a reno for this, as it's a big enough fix that we should make sure it's called out."}, {'account_id': 14810, 'date': '2016-01-20 04:02:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

commit_message:
Fail deploy if agent returns >= 400

Currently the status code returned by IPA's POST /v1/commands API is
completely ignored by Ironic. This causes deploys to get stuck, as
future heartbeats will see that the command has not yet been accepted
and will continue to wait.

If IPA returns an error code to Ironic's agent client, we should bubble
that exception up, causing a deploy failure higher in the chain.

This adds an AgentAPIError exception class, and raises it when the agent
returns a 400 status code or higher when issuing a command.

Co-Authored-By: Jay Faulkner <jay@jvf.cc>

Related-bug: 1542506
Change-Id: I07fb8115d254e877d8781207eaec203e3fdf8ad6

[{'created': '2017-11-17 07:40:08.000000000', 'message': "Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at

commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html

Change-Id: I2b9944d91ec6f4c1822591092d4551ee85f0de5e

commit_message:
Clean up bindep.txt file

With zuulv3, we are now using bindep.txt more to manage
build-wheel-jobs.  As such, give an update to start supporting
centos-7. I've also cleaned up a few depedencies we no longer need.

This also add support to test wheel-mirror builds.

Change-Id: Ia6c1113d119b01e7189e4ada41e10865c4ec0066
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
cleanup: Remove useless test and fixes another

The given test does not test any actual code, as the code itself
resides in hyperv_neutron_agent.

The fixed test was not running, as it did not start with the test
prefix, and it was broken.

Change-Id: Ifcad783a9e4c43871666a3b68a956eb496d0cbad

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-16 21:01:19.000000000', 'message': "Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: I16981e37c2e641c05fa65d5151b3dadf1e951482
"}]
commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: I16981e37c2e641c05fa65d5151b3dadf1e951482

[{'created': '2017-11-16 21:33:15.000000000', 'message': "Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely

commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: I5d7c550414c9bf0f7eaa6116d2a5502750777638

commit_message:
[placement] manage cache headers for allocations

In microversion 1.11 and cache-control and last-modified headers
when listing allocations, either via GET /allocations/{consumer_uuid}
or GET /resource_providers/{uuid}/allocations.

In either case, the last-modified time is the created_at time of the
most recently created Allocation in the allocations collection.
Allocations never have an updated_at time because they are only
inserted, never updated.

Change-Id: I9934f49fc9adab0abffcdb20182fc65986e4e8c7
Partial-Bug: #1632852
Partially-Implements: bp placement-cache-headers

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-25 16:32:40.000000000', 'message': '[placement] manage cache headers for aggregates

As part of microversion 1.11, add cache-control and last-modified
headers to GET and PUT /resource_providers/{uuid}/aggregates.

In this case the time in the header is the current time.

While aggregates do have created_at and updated_at times, what matters
here is when the resource provider was made a member of the aggregate,
which is not something we expose anywhere. The time fields are present
on the ResourceProviderAggregate model (which joins resource providers
to aggregates) but neither set_aggregates nor get_aggregates on the
ResourceProvider OVO provides access to this info and adding it would be
more effort than it is worth. And finally, setting an aggregate
membership does not change the resource provider generation, so the
update_at time on the ResourceProvider is of no use in this case as
well.

Thus current time.

Change-Id: I573deb680264564365aec3fa450250c4b00e476d
Partial-Bug: #1632852
Partially-Implements: bp placement-cache-headers
'}, {'created': '2017-11-19 12:49:49.000000000', 'message': '[placement] manage cache headers for aggregates

As part of microversion 1.11, add cache-control and last-modified
headers to GET and PUT /resource_providers/{uuid}/aggregates.

In this case the time in the header is the current time.

While aggregates do have created_at and updated_at times, what matters
here is when the resource provider was made a member of the aggregate,
which is not something we expose anywhere. The time fields are present
on the ResourceProviderAggregate model (which joins resource providers
to aggregates) but neither set_aggregates nor get_aggregates on the
ResourceProvider OVO provides access to this info and adding it would be
more effort than it is worth. And finally, setting an aggregate
membership does not change the resource provider generation, so the
update_at time on the ResourceProvider is of no use in this case as
well.

Thus current time.

Change-Id: I573deb680264564365aec3fa450250c4b00e476d
Partial-Bug: #1632852
Partially-Implements: bp placement-cache-headers
'}]
commit_message:
[placement] manage cache headers for aggregates

As part of microversion 1.11, add cache-control and last-modified
headers to GET and PUT /resource_providers/{uuid}/aggregates.

In this case the time in the header is the current time.

While aggregates do have created_at and updated_at times, what matters
here is when the resource provider was made a member of the aggregate,
which is not something we expose anywhere. The time fields are present
on the ResourceProviderAggregate model (which joins resource providers
to aggregates) but neither set_aggregates nor get_aggregates on the
ResourceProvider OVO provides access to this info and adding it would be
more effort than it is worth. And finally, setting an aggregate
membership does not change the resource provider generation, so the
update_at time on the ResourceProvider is of no use in this case as
well.

Thus current time.

Change-Id: I573deb680264564365aec3fa450250c4b00e476d
Partial-Bug: #1632852
Partially-Implements: bp placement-cache-headers

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-18 19:53:02.000000000', 'message': '[placement] manage cache headers for usages

Add last-modifed and cache-control headers to GET /usages and
/resource_providers/{uuid}/usages in a 1.11 microversions.

Since these resources are the result of a complex composition
that is expected to change frequently, the last-modified time
is set to utcnow. While it would be possible to calculate a
time based on the updated time of the most recent allocation
used to generate the usages, it doesn't seem worth it since
the question represented by the requests is "what is the usage
_now_"?

Change-Id: Ibf887ed72889e99fc8bfe15b6761f796b029e964
Partial-Bug: #1632852
Partially-Implements: bp placement-cache-headers

used to generate the usages, it doesn't seem worth it since
the question represented by the requests is "what is the usage
_now_"?

Change-Id: Ibf887ed72889e99fc8bfe15b6761f796b029e964

Partially-Implements: bp placement-cache-headers

commit_message:
[placement] manage cache headers for usages

Add last-modifed and cache-control headers to GET /usages and
/resource_providers/{uuid}/usages in a 1.11 microversion.

Since these resources are the result of a complex composition
that is expected to change frequently, the last-modified time
is set to utcnow. While it would be possible to calculate a
time based on the updated time of the most recent allocation
used to generate the usages, it doesn't seem worth it since
the question represented by the requests is "what is the usage
_now_"?

Change-Id: Ibf887ed72889e99fc8bfe15b6761f796b029e964
Partial-Bug: #1632852
Partially-Implements: bp placement-cache-headers

commit_message:
[placement] manage cache headers for resource classes

The details of which requests (and microversion) get a last-modified
and cache-control header are in resource-classes-last-modified.yaml.

Due the presence of the resource class cache, exposing the updated_at
and created_at fields which are already available in the database (as a
result of the TimestampMixin) required a fair amount of adjustment in
nova/objects/resource_provider.py and
nova/db/sqlalchemy/resource_class_cache.py. The overarching change is
adding the all_from_string method on the rc_cache which returns the full
details of a resource class from a new all_cache. There were other
option for doing this (expanding one of the existing caches, getting rid
of caching altogether). The method chosen felt like it had minimal
impact on other code.

Change-Id: Ic488c7204d9462f801da7c3e66cb6d00e01243be
Partial-Bug: #1632852
Partially-Implements: bp placement-cache-headers

commit_message:
[placement] manage cache headers for inventories

Add cache-control and last-modified headers to:

* GET /resource_providers/{uuid}/inventories
* GET /resource_provider/{uuid}/inventories/{class}
* PUT /resource_provier/{uuid}/inventories (which returns
  a body)

The existing updated_at and created_at columns are used as data
sources. In the case of PUT these fields have not been implemented
on the objects (because they have not been created) so the current
time is used instead (which makes sense).

The database query for getting inventory is adjusted to include the
updated_at and created_at columns.

Change-Id: If9e2bf494ee751a3f60a7b2f330e99b11b869d76
Partial-Bug: #1632852
Partially-Implements: bp placement-cache-headers

subject: [placement] manage cache headers for /resource_providers

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-18 17:03:17.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: [placement] manage cache headers

This is a small demonstration of the changes that would be needed to
have the placement service producing the cache-control and last-modified
headers that it should be if it wants to be exhibiting correct behavior.
According the HTTP 1.1 RFC headers last-modified headers SHOULD always
be sent and if we do send them, we need Cache-Control headers. Despite
what it says 'no-cache' means "check to see if the version you have is
still valid as far as the server is concerned". Since our server doesn't
currently valdate conditional requests and will always return an entity,
it ends up meaning "don't cache" (which is what we want).

The main steps are:

* Add the base.NovaTimestampObject mixin to the relevant object in
  nova/objects/resource_provider.py
* To both the get single entity and get collection handlers add
  response.cache_control = 'no-cache'
* For single entity add response.last_modified = obj.updated_at or
  obj.created_at
* For collection, use a new list_last_modified utility method.

In typical placement framework fashion this has been done in a very
explicit way, as it makes what the handler is doing very visible, even
though it results in a bit of boilerplate.

So far this only does GET /resource_providers and GET
/resource_providers/{uuid}. If we don't like the idea, not worth going
further.

More discussion on the os-dev list shortly.

Change-Id: Ied97539db31c764b8ec311abf977736dc748ef64
Partial-Bug: #1632852
'}, {'created': '2017-08-21 17:21:06.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: [placement] manage cache headers

This is a small demonstration of the changes that would be needed to
have the placement service producing the cache-control and last-modified
headers that it should be if it wants to be exhibiting correct behavior.
According the HTTP 1.1 RFC headers last-modified headers SHOULD always
be sent and if we do send them, we need Cache-Control headers. Despite
what it says 'no-cache' means "check to see if the version you have is
still valid as far as the server is concerned". Since our server doesn't
currently valdate conditional requests and will always return an entity,
it ends up meaning "don't cache" (which is what we want).

The main steps are:

* Add the base.NovaTimestampObject mixin to the relevant object in
  nova/objects/resource_provider.py
* To both the get single entity and get collection handlers add
  response.cache_control = 'no-cache'
* For single entity add response.last_modified = obj.updated_at or
  obj.created_at
* For collection, discover the max modified time when traversing the
  list of object to create the serialized JSON output.

In typical placement framework fashion this has been done in a very
explicit way, as it makes what the handler is doing very visible, even
though it results in a bit of boilerplate.

So far this only does GET /resource_providers and GET
/resource_providers/{uuid}. Other resources which have a direct
relationship to database tables can get the same treatment. For those
resources (such as /allocation_candidates) that are composed, we should
set last_modified time to now().

Because these changes add new headers (even though they don't do
anything) a new microversion, 1.11.

Change-Id: Ied97539db31c764b8ec311abf977736dc748ef64
Partial-Bug: #1632852

what it says 'no-cache' means "check to see if the version you have is

it ends up meaning "don't cache" (which is what we want).

* Add the base.NovaTimestampObject mixin to the relevant object in
  nova/objects/resource_provider.py
* To both the get single entity and get collection handlers add
  response.cache_control = 'no-cache'
* For single entity add response.last_modified = obj.updated_at or
  obj.created_at
* For collection, discover the max modified time when traversing the

'}, {'created': '2017-10-10 17:14:36.000000000', 'message': '[placement] manage cache headers for /resource_providers

According the HTTP 1.1 RFC headers last-modified headers SHOULD always
be sent and should have a tie to the real last modified time. If we do
send them, we need Cache-Control headers to prevent inadvertent caching
of resources.

This change adds a microversion 1.11 which adds the headers to GET
/resource_providers and GET /resource_providers/{uuid}.

Despite what it says 'no-cache' means "check to see if the version you
have is still valid as far as the server is concerned". Since our server
doesn't currently valdate conditional requests and will always return an
entity, it ends up meaning "don't cache" (which is what we want).

The main steps are:

* map base.NovaTimestampObject to ovo.TimestampedObject
* Add the base.NovaTimestampObject mixin to the relevant object in
  nova/objects/resource_provider.py
* To both the get single entity and get collection handlers add
  response.cache_control = 'no-cache'
* For single entity add response.last_modified = obj.updated_at or
  obj.created_at
* For collection, discover the max modified time when traversing the
  list of object to create the serialized JSON output.

In typical placement framework fashion this has been done in a very
explicit way, as it makes what the handler is doing very visible, even
though it results in a bit of boilerplate.

Other resources which have a direct relationship to database tables
like resource providers, will get the same treatment in subsequent
patches. For those resources (such as /allocation_candidates) that
are composed, we should set last_modified time to now().

Because these changes add new headers (even though they don't do
anything) a new microversion, 1.11, is in added. Since presumably we
don't want to add a new microversion for each patch, we start it
here and assumpe the subsequent patches will use the same microversion.

The depends on is to a requirements change to bump
oslo.versionedobjects to 1.28.0 which has the TimestampedObject.

Partial-Bug: #1632852
Partially-Implements: bp placement-cache-headers
Change-Id: Ied97539db31c764b8ec311abf977736dc748ef64
Depends-On: Ia94ce24627072eb91df2370b40e1680dd8eacde9
'}, {'created': '2017-10-16 13:13:12.000000000', 'message': '[placement] manage cache headers for /resource_providers

According the HTTP 1.1 RFC headers last-modified headers SHOULD always
be sent and should have a tie to the real last modified time. If we do
send them, we need Cache-Control headers to prevent inadvertent caching
of resources.

This change adds a microversion 1.11 which adds the headers to GET
/resource_providers and GET and PUT /resource_providers/{uuid}.

Despite what it says 'no-cache' means "check to see if the version you
have is still valid as far as the server is concerned". Since our server
doesn't currently valdate conditional requests and will always return an
entity, it ends up meaning "don't cache" (which is what we want).

The main steps are:

* map base.NovaTimestampObject to ovo.TimestampedObject
* Add the base.NovaTimestampObject mixin to the relevant object in
  nova/objects/resource_provider.py
* To both the get single entity and get collection handlers add
  response.cache_control = 'no-cache'
* For single entity add response.last_modified = obj.updated_at or
  obj.created_at
* For collection, discover the max modified time when traversing the
  list of object to create the serialized JSON output. This is assisted
  by a new util method: pick_last_modfied.
* For put use obj.created_at directly

In typical placement framework fashion this has been done in a very
explicit way, as it makes what the handler is doing very visible, even
though it results in a bit of boilerplate.

Other resources which have a direct relationship to database tables
like resource providers, will get the same treatment in subsequent
patches. For those resources (such as /allocation_candidates) that
are composed, we should set last_modified time to now().

Because these changes add new headers (even though they don't do
anything) a new microversion, 1.11, is added. Since presumably we
don't want to add a new microversion for each patch, we start it
here and assume the subsequent patches will use the same microversion.

Partial-Bug: #1632852
Partially-Implements: bp placement-cache-headers
Change-Id: Ied97539db31c764b8ec311abf977736dc748ef64
'}, {'created': '2017-10-25 16:32:40.000000000', 'message': '[placement] manage cache headers for /resource_providers

According the HTTP 1.1 RFC headers last-modified headers SHOULD always
be sent and should have a tie to the real last modified time. If we do
send them, we need Cache-Control headers to prevent inadvertent caching
of resources.

This change adds a microversion 1.11 which adds the headers to GET
/resource_providers and GET and PUT /resource_providers/{uuid}.

Despite what it says 'no-cache' means "check to see if the version you
have is still valid as far as the server is concerned". Since our server
doesn't currently validate conditional requests and will always return an
entity, it ends up meaning "don't cache" (which is what we want).

The main steps are:

* map base.NovaTimestampObject to ovo.TimestampedObject
* Add the base.NovaTimestampObject mixin to the relevant object in
  nova/objects/resource_provider.py
* To both the get single entity and get collection handlers add
  response.cache_control = 'no-cache'
* For single entity add response.last_modified = obj.updated_at or
  obj.created_at
* For collections, discover the max modified time when traversing the
  list of objects to create the serialized JSON output. This is assisted
  by a new util method: pick_last_modfied.
* For PUT use the current time

In typical placement framework fashion this has been done in a very
explicit way, as it makes what the handler is doing very visible, even
though it results in a bit of boilerplate.

Other resources which have a direct relationship to database tables will
get the same treatment in subsequent patches. For those resources (such
as /allocation_candidates) that are composed, we should set
last_modified time to the current time.

Because these changes add new headers (even though they don't do
anything) a new microversion, 1.11, is added. Since presumably we
don't want to add a new microversion for each patch, we start it
here and assume the subsequent patches will use the same microversion.
The final patch in the series will include the necessary release note
and version history update.

Partial-Bug: #1632852
Partially-Implements: bp placement-cache-headers
Change-Id: Ied97539db31c764b8ec311abf977736dc748ef64
