/resource_providers and GET and PUT /resource_providers/{uuid}.

Despite what it says 'no-cache' means "check to see if the version you
have is still valid as far as the server is concerned". Since our server
doesn't currently validate conditional requests and will always return an
entity, it ends up meaning "don't cache" (which is what we want).

The main steps are:

* map base.NovaTimestampObject to ovo.TimestampedObject
* Add the base.NovaTimestampObject mixin to the relevant object in
  nova/objects/resource_provider.py
* To both the get single entity and get collection handlers add
  response.cache_control = 'no-cache'
* For single entity add response.last_modified = obj.updated_at or
  obj.created_at
* For collections, discover the max modified time when traversing the
  list of objects to create the serialized JSON output. This is assisted
  by a new util method: pick_last_modfied.
* For PUT use the current time

In typical placement framework fashion this has been done in a very
explicit way, as it makes what the handler is doing very visible, even
though it results in a bit of boilerplate.

Other resources which have a direct relationship to database tables will
get the same treatment in subsequent patches. For those resources (such
as /allocation_candidates) that are composed, we should set
last_modified time to the current time.

Because these changes add new headers (even though they don't do
anything) a new microversion, 1.11, is added. Since presumably we
don't want to add a new microversion for each patch, we start it
here and assume the subsequent patches will use the same microversion.
The final patch in the series will include the necessary release note
and version history update.

Partial-Bug: #1632852
Partially-Implements: bp placement-cache-headers
Change-Id: Ied97539db31c764b8ec311abf977736dc748ef64
'}]
commit_message:
[placement] manage cache headers for /resource_providers

According the HTTP 1.1 RFC headers last-modified headers SHOULD always
be sent and should have a tie to the real last modified time. If we do
send them, we need Cache-Control headers to prevent inadvertent caching
of resources.

This change adds a microversion 1.11 which adds the headers to GET
/resource_providers and GET and PUT /resource_providers/{uuid}.

Despite what it says 'no-cache' means "check to see if the version you
have is still valid as far as the server is concerned". Since our server
doesn't currently validate conditional requests and will always return an
entity, it ends up meaning "don't cache" (which is what we want).

The main steps are:

* map base.NovaTimestampObject to ovo.TimestampedObject
* Add the base.NovaTimestampObject mixin to the relevant object in
  nova/objects/resource_provider.py
* To both the get single entity and get collection handlers add
  response.cache_control = 'no-cache'
* For single entity add response.last_modified = obj.updated_at or
  obj.created_at
* For collections, discover the max modified time when traversing the
  list of objects to create the serialized JSON output. This is assisted
  by a new util method: pick_last_modfied.
* For PUT use the current time

In typical placement framework fashion this has been done in a very
explicit way, as it makes what the handler is doing very visible, even
though it results in a bit of boilerplate.

Other resources which have a direct relationship to database tables will
get the same treatment in subsequent patches. For those resources (such
as /allocation_candidates) that are composed, we should set
last_modified time to the current time.

Because these changes add new headers (even though they don't do
anything) a new microversion, 1.11, is added. Since presumably we
don't want to add a new microversion for each patch, we start it
here and assume the subsequent patches will use the same microversion.
The final patch in the series will include the necessary release note
and version history update.

Partial-Bug: #1632852
Partially-Implements: bp placement-cache-headers
Change-Id: Ied97539db31c764b8ec311abf977736dc748ef64

The deployed servers scenario expects necessary packages to be installed.
Ceph packages are installed to run ceph commands on the container host.

commit_message:
WIP scenario001-multinode-oooq-container host doesn't need ceph package

The deployed servers scenario expects necessary packages to be installed.
Ceph packages are installed to run ceph commands on the container host.
As per a proposed ceph-ansible change [1] they don't need to be so this
frees up a requirement.

[1] https://github.com/ceph/ceph-ansible/pull/1865

Change-Id: I59a43bc87b5a04b6617441b948f754f375bc3854

commit_message:
WIP: ceph-ansible invocation w/ ANSIBLE_STDOUT_CALLBACK=debug

Add new environment variable to ceph-ansible execution with
ANSIBLE_STDOUT_CALLBACK=debug so that in /var/log/mistral/
ceph-install-workflow.log will contain logs in a different
format.

Change-Id: Iad2433f73053fd4e02517601d79479fa00e43597

Make the cache prep timeout configurable

In some environments it may be desirable to adjust the
cache timeout. This makes that possible.

[{'created': '2017-11-06 10:25:13.000000000', 'message': 'Add condition to os-net-config run during upgrade.

This add two conditionals:
 - first check that os-net-config needs upgrade
 - second verify that the configuration file exist and non empty.

This prevent unnecessary run of os-net-config and error in certain
network configuration.

commit_message:
Add condition to os-net-config run during upgrade.

This add two conditionals:
 - first check that os-net-config needs upgrade
 - second verify that the configuration file exist and non empty.

This prevent unnecessary run of os-net-config and error in certain
network configuration.

Change-Id: Ic905f7ed7e7fc9018bc494f77811392045fddfe8
Closes-Bug: #1730328

commit_message:
change kafka repo location in devstack

  kafka 0.9.0.1 is now archived and nolonger available in apache mirrors
  this overrides apache mirror location for kafka install.

Change-Id: Id5826adc0bbbc79480d4ba707681537a312c01e2

subject: Temporarily make opensuse jobs non-voting
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-20 17:44:57.000000000', 'message': "Temporarily make opensuse jobs non-voting

As we're getting failures for opensuse jobs due to broken
mirrors so we're forced to switch all opensuse tests to
non-voting until the infra mirrors are fixed.

Change-Id: I4147396c5b9b592088c9d846b506f53bf27fbe43
"}]
commit_message:
Temporarily make opensuse jobs non-voting

As we're getting failures for opensuse jobs due to broken
mirrors so we're forced to switch all opensuse tests to
non-voting until the infra mirrors are fixed.

Change-Id: I4147396c5b9b592088c9d846b506f53bf27fbe43

commit_message:
Fix a typo in the comment in kubelet-container

set 'to_this' one --> set to 'this_one'

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Icb6946d36a37c91a87a922320f1388f3c53c6c59

[{'created': '2017-05-24 19:32:43.000000000', 'message': 'DNM rework keystone auth for glance

a pile of changes to test. Will be split into more patches.

Change-Id: I6a93b71ac097e951dfc93fd1ee4d7ef483514f2c
'}, {'created': '2017-05-25 15:49:45.000000000', 'message': 'DNM rework keystone auth for glance

a pile of changes to test. Will be split into more patches.

Change-Id: I6a93b71ac097e951dfc93fd1ee4d7ef483514f2c
'}, {'created': '2017-06-06 16:22:46.000000000', 'message': 'Rework keystone auth for glance

this patch changes the way glance client is instantiated, using
keystoneauth sessions and adapters.

In order to support glance API endpoint discovery from keystone catalig
and more unified way of client loading,
many options in [glance] config sections are deprecated, mostly those
that specified a (set of) glance API endpoint(s), some piece-wise.
Instead, a single option [glance]endpoint_override must be used when
required to access a specific (possibly load-balanced) glance API endpoint
without discovering it from keystone catalog.

Another set of deprecated options are those that are duplicating
keystoneauth session options in [glance] section.

Also, support for specifying a glance image reference using `glance://`
url scheme (possibly including glance API location) is deprecated.
After deprecation period, only UUID of a glance image will be supported as
glance image reference, and having UUID as image source will
automatically presume glance image.

As a side-effect of this patch, when configured properly, ironic should now
support glance API deployed under Apache vhost (with more complex URI
and no port).

Change-Id: I6a93b71ac097e951dfc93fd1ee4d7ef483514f2c
'}, {'created': '2017-06-06 17:11:15.000000000', 'message': 'Rework keystone auth for glance

keystoneauth sessions and adapters.

In order to support glance API endpoint discovery from keystone catalig
and more unified way of client loading,
many options in [glance] config sections are deprecated, mostly those
that specified a (set of) glance API endpoint(s), some piece-wise.
Instead, a single option [glance]endpoint_override must be used when
required to access a specific (possibly load-balanced) glance API endpoint
without discovering it from keystone catalog.

Another set of deprecated options are those that are duplicating
keystoneauth session options in [glance] section.

Also, support for specifying a glance image reference using `glance://`
url scheme (possibly including glance API location) is deprecated.
After deprecation period, only UUID of a glance image will be supported as
glance image reference, and having UUID as image source will
automatically presume glance image.

As a side-effect of this patch, when configured properly, ironic should now
support glance API deployed under Apache vhost (with more complex URI
and no port).

Change-Id: I6a93b71ac097e951dfc93fd1ee4d7ef483514f2c

commit_message:
Rework keystone auth for glance

this patch changes the way glance client is instantiated, using
keystoneauth sessions and adapters.

In order to support glance API endpoint discovery from keystone catalog
and more unified way of client loading,
many options in `[glance]` config sections are deprecated,
mostly those that specified a (set of) glance API endpoint(s)
or parts of glance API address.
Instead, a single option `[glance]endpoint_override` must be used when
required to access a specific (possibly load-balanced)
glance API endpoint without discovering it from keystone catalog.

Another set of deprecated options are those that are duplicating
keystoneauth session options in [glance] section.

Also, intrinsic support for parsing the glance API URL from image ref
set to the full glance REST path to the image is removed as it was not
working any way since an 'http(s)://' image ref is not treated
as a glance image.

Change-Id: I6a93b71ac097e951dfc93fd1ee4d7ef483514f2c
Partial-Bug: #1699547
Closes-Bug: #1699542

subject: Revert opensuse workaround and make opensuse non-voting
messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2017-11-20 15:51:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2017-11-20 15:51:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2017-11-20 15:53:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2017-11-20 15:53:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-20 15:51:04.000000000', 'message': "Revert opensuse workaround and make opensuse non-voting

This reverts commit f69d088d1db575216b28b7c5cc5827be8f71e021
as it was meant as a workaround while the infra mirrors are
sorted out.

As we're getting failures for opensuse jobs due to timeouts
with the upstream mirrors we're forced to switch all opensuse
tests to non-voting until the infra mirrors are fixed.

Change-Id: I50b50f3d098a83010d6411f8ea09fbce9ae7f638
"}]
commit_message:
Revert opensuse workaround and make opensuse non-voting

This reverts commit f69d088d1db575216b28b7c5cc5827be8f71e021
as it was meant as a workaround while the infra mirrors are
sorted out.

As we're getting failures for opensuse jobs due to timeouts
with the upstream mirrors we're forced to switch all opensuse
tests to non-voting until the infra mirrors are fixed.

Change-Id: I50b50f3d098a83010d6411f8ea09fbce9ae7f638

tempest: update to follow code deprecation

  DeprecationWarning: Function 'tempest.test.services()' has moved to
  'tempest.common.utils.services()' in version 'Pike' and will be
  removed in a future version

  @test.services('compute', 'network')

subject: Expose include_rules param in library policy API GET methods
messages:
[{'account_id': 11278, 'date': '2017-11-01 05:16:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2017-11-01 18:36:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi Anusha!

Patch looks reasonable. But I do wonder whether it's needed (by dashboard I assume). I initially did not include the option in API because I figured it's easy enough for API consumer to ignore the rules. And the extra bandwidth required to transmit the rules is usually negligible unless the number of rules is HUGE. Not including the option reduces the API complexity we commit to supporting.

That said the patch looks fine and I don't mind the option if it's needed or significantly improves things for dashboard.

Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 11278, 'date': '2017-11-02 03:27:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi Eric, Thanks for the review. ya, for dashboard, I query multiple times, where i need only policy info, then rules seem unnecessary data,  Then I saw the option to include/not to include rules in API, so thought as option is available, good to use. Is there are separate usecase , you have added that option (include_rules?).
I don't think , we are adding any complexity to the API, its already existing interface, we are using, so I think should be fine. wdyt?"}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2017-11-03 01:56:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi Anusha. I implemented the include_rules option in the code because I also anticipated exposing it in API. But when I thought about it more, I concluded it's really not necessary for API consumers to have that option (unless the number of policy rules is HUGE).
Generally speaking, when something is exposed through the API it becomes a promise we'll continue supporting it for a long time (third parties will write code counting on support to continue). So I generally prefer to keep things out of the API unless it is actually needed, even if internally we have the implementation to support it. That way, we don't make a promise to continue supporting it.

I can see going either way in this case. I'm happy with whichever way you think is better based on your use of the APIs =)"}, {'account_id': 11278, 'date': '2017-11-06 10:41:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11278, 'date': '2017-11-06 10:45:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

As per discussion on IRC , updated the patch set.'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2017-11-07 01:03:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2017-11-07 01:05:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

Added unit tests that exercise the added param. And while I was at it also updated the commit message to document the reason behind the change.'}, {'account_id': 11278, 'date': '2017-11-07 03:48:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Ok, Thanks Eric.'}, {'account_id': 25254, 'date': '2017-11-14 03:23:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

lgtm'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2017-11-20 14:08:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2017-11-20 15:22:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}]

As there is option to retrieve policy with/without rules, this commit
makes the same configurable from API

Change-Id: Ife220ba059759394b40cba9eb24f9dc76448ef9f
'}, {'created': '2017-11-06 10:41:33.000000000', 'message': 'Make include rules configurable from API

As there is option to retrieve policy with/without rules, this commit
makes the same configurable from API

Change-Id: Ife220ba059759394b40cba9eb24f9dc76448ef9f
'}, {'created': '2017-11-07 01:03:23.000000000', 'message': 'Expose include_rules param in library policy API GET methods

It is convenient for API consumers such as congress-dashboard
to have the option on whether to include all the
policy rules when retrieving library policies.

Change-Id: Ife220ba059759394b40cba9eb24f9dc76448ef9f
'}]
commit_message:
Expose include_rules param in library policy API GET methods

It is convenient for API consumers such as congress-dashboard
to have the option on whether to include all the
policy rules when retrieving library policies.

Change-Id: Ife220ba059759394b40cba9eb24f9dc76448ef9f

commit_message:
Cast content-length to an int when comparing sizes

Let's compare int with int instead of int with string.  This fixes the
log rotation logic in logging_to_swift.

Change-Id: Id59489d5c9c6c3a806bbfe104479d3884b62fc05
Closes-Bug: #1731472

commit_message:
zuul: run TripleO jobs with new zuulv3 layout

Configure the layout to execute the scenario001 and 002 jobs.
Note that baremetal job will be run on stable/pike and container on
Queens and beyond.

A note has been added in comment explaining more details.

Change-Id: I84831e66ec6341272a1dc1bba420e484df02405e
(cherry picked from commit 92e25f55db24a157d50ef9cbbc7054399f174dba)

commit_message:
Be more prescriptive in log collection

list out the files and directories we collect
for /var/log and /etc/

Related-Bug: #1723182
Closes-Bug: #1731456

commit_message:
zuul: run TripleO jobs with new zuulv3 layout

Configure the layout to execute the scenario001 and 002 jobs.
Note that baremetal job will be run on stable/pike and container on
Queens and beyond.

A note has been added in comment explaining more details.

Change-Id: Ic9fc3bd769a5ccafb3f81fe55513c96d611dbe7d
(cherry picked from commit 510d1c7740a5829e07979ec384bdbb7d94ad2870)

commit_message:
zuul: run TripleO jobs with new zuulv3 layout

Configure the layout to execute the scenario001 and 002 jobs.
Note that baremetal job will be run on stable/pike and container on
Queens and beyond.

A note has been added in comment explaining more details.

Change-Id: Ic9fc3bd769a5ccafb3f81fe55513c96d611dbe7d
(cherry picked from commit 510d1c7740a5829e07979ec384bdbb7d94ad2870)

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-20 14:43:54.000000000', 'message': 'place release notes inline

Replace the instructions for querying for release notes with the
results of a reno report because some of the broken release notes are
on branches that have been closed and we have no way to edit them.

Fix the markup by replacing LaTeX style quotes with RST quotes.

Change-Id: I4a42c099280a8cd16e9efa3756058b1ed905926c
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
place release notes inline

Replace the instructions for querying for release notes with the
results of a reno report because some of the broken release notes are
on branches that have been closed and we have no way to edit them.

Fix the markup by replacing LaTeX style quotes with RST quotes.

Change-Id: I4a42c099280a8cd16e9efa3756058b1ed905926c
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Disable py35 jobs for os-net-config/newton

We don't support python 3 on os-net-config/newton.

Change-Id: Id4fe40dfc3116003f4ff857e16a2901217be3d81

commit_message:
neutron: release a new 11.0.2 tag for Pike

In current stable Pike branch there are:
 - 8 bugfixes for neutron
 - 2 bugfixes for neutron-lbaas
 - other projects do not contain any bugfixes

Change-Id: I4a59a8467af2ebffe9dc3e8da4c35d522721c014

[{'created': '2017-11-17 19:01:06.000000000', 'message': 'zuul: run TripleO jobs with new zuulv3 layout

Configure the layout to execute the scenario001 and 002 jobs.
Note that baremetal job will be run on stable/pike and container on
Queens and beyond.

A note has been added in comment explaining more details.

Change-Id: I8aa6e15c0a350e27058a16dab12b3a8baaf41838

commit_message:
zuul: run TripleO jobs with new zuulv3 layout

Configure the layout to execute the scenario001 and 002 jobs.
Note that baremetal job will be run on stable/pike and container on
Queens and beyond.

A note has been added in comment explaining more details.

Change-Id: I8aa6e15c0a350e27058a16dab12b3a8baaf41838

commit_message:
test_network_v6: log console when test fails

Console may help debugging failures when they happen. For example, if an
IP address was not configured for an instance, console output may reveal
that dhcp client failed to get the lease in due time.

Also log failed ip address output.

Change-Id: I7189c6d261c4d8b74aee23f360becc1171d17501
